# Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig>
## Decree-Law No. 65 of 2025
### Amending the Penal Code
### Issued by Law No. (16) of 1960

- Having reviewed the Constitution,
- And Amiri Order issued on 2 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1445 AH corresponding to
10 May 2024 AD,
- And Penal Code issued by Law No. (16) of 1960
and its amending laws,
- And Law of Criminal Procedures and Trials issued by Law No.
(17) of 1960, and its amending laws,
- And Law of Civil and Commercial Procedures issued by Decree-Law
No. (38) of 1980, and its amending laws,
- And Decree No. 84 of 2024 regarding Ministerial Succession and Delegations,
and its amending decrees,
- And based on the submission of the Minister of Justice <orig>وزير العدل</orig>,
- And after the approval of the Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig>,
- We have issued the following Decree-Law:

(Article One)
The texts of Articles (44, first paragraph, 154, 164) of
the aforementioned Penal Code shall be replaced with the following texts:

### Article (44, First Paragraph):
Unintentional error shall be deemed present if the perpetrator, when committing the act,
behaved in a manner that an ordinary person would not, if placed in the same circumstances,
by acting with recklessness, negligence, carelessness, inattention, or disregard for laws and regulations.

### Article (154):
Whoever kills a person by mistake or unintentionally causes their death, where such act results from recklessness, negligence, carelessness, inattention, disregard for laws and regulations, or a breach of the principles of their job, profession, or craft, shall be punished by imprisonment for a period not exceeding three years and a fine not exceeding one thousand dinars <orig>دينار</orig> and not less than five hundred dinars <orig>دينار</orig>, or by one of these two penalties.

### Article (164):
Whoever unintentionally causes injury to another or inflicts tangible harm upon them, where such act results from recklessness, negligence, carelessness, inattention, disregard for laws and regulations, or a breach of the principles of their job, profession, or craft, shall be punished by imprisonment for a period not exceeding one year and a fine not exceeding five hundred dinars <orig>دينار</orig> and not less than two hundred and fifty dinars <orig>دينار</orig>, or by one of these two penalties.

(Article Two)
Two new articles, numbered (154 bis, 164 bis), shall be added to the aforementioned Penal Code <orig>قانون الجزاء</orig>, with the following texts:

### (Article 154 bis)
The homicide mentioned in the preceding article shall be punishable by imprisonment for a period not exceeding five years and a fine not exceeding two thousand dinars <orig>دينار</orig> and not less than one thousand dinars <orig>دينار</orig>, or by one of these two penalties, if the homicide is associated with one of the following circumstances:
1- The perpetrator's consumption of an intoxicating, narcotic, psychotropic, or any other substance affecting a person's natural faculties.
2- If the perpetrator's act results in the death of two or more persons.
3- The perpetrator's refusal or negligence to assist the victim at the time of committing the act, while being capable of doing so.
The penalty shall be imprisonment for a period not exceeding ten years and a fine not exceeding ten thousand dinars <orig>دينار</orig>, or by one of these two penalties, if two or more of the circumstances stipulated in the preceding paragraph are combined.

### (Article 164 bis)
The injury mentioned in the preceding article shall be punishable by imprisonment for a period not exceeding two years and a fine not exceeding one thousand dinars <orig>دينار</orig> and not less than five hundred dinars <orig>دينار</orig>, or by one of these two penalties, if it is associated with one of the following circumstances:
1- The perpetrator's consumption of an intoxicating, narcotic, psychotropic, or any other substance affecting a person's natural faculties.
2- If the perpetrator's act results in injury to two or more persons.
3- If the perpetrator's act results in the victim suffering a permanent disability.
4- The perpetrator's refusal or negligence to assist the victim at the time of committing the act, while being capable of doing so.
The penalty shall be imprisonment for a period not exceeding three years and a fine not exceeding two thousand dinars <orig>دينار</orig> and not less than one thousand dinars <orig>دينار</orig>, or by one of these two penalties, if two or more of the circumstances stipulated in the preceding paragraph are combined.

(Article Three)
A new clause numbered (8) titled (Debtor's Proximity to Payment) shall be added to Chapter Three (Crimes Against Property) of Book Three (Crimes Against Individuals) of the aforementioned Penal Code <orig>قانون الجزاء</orig>, comprising new articles numbered (283, 284, 285, 286) with the following texts:

### Article (283):
Every debtor who commits any of the following acts shall be punished by imprisonment for a period not exceeding three years and a fine not exceeding five thousand dinars <orig>دينار</orig>, or by one of these two penalties:
1- Concealing, smuggling, or improperly disposing of their assets, whether through traditional or electronic means, with the intent of not fulfilling their established debts based on an enforceable instrument.
2- Acknowledging debts not owed by them, or reducing their assets or rights due from third parties, with the intent of not fulfilling their established debts based on an enforceable instrument.
The criminal case shall lapse, regardless of its stage, if the accused settles the debt, reconciles with the creditor, or is pardoned by them.
If settlement, reconciliation, or pardon occurs after a final conviction judgment has been issued, the court that issued the judgment may order the suspension of the imposed penalty upon the request of the convicted person.

## Explanatory Memorandum
### for Decree-Law No. 65 of 2025
Amending the Penal Code <orig>قانون الجزاء</orig> issued by Law No. (16) of 1960

The penal punishment stipulated by law is considered a cornerstone in building
the general theory of crime. This punishment is keenly observed by the legislator and the judge,
and it is relied upon by the hearts of citizens and residents alike; for without it,
the articles of law would be nothing more than moral advice, heeded by those who wish and defied by
those who wish.
For punishment to bear its fruit in instilling security and tranquility in society and quenching
the thirst for justice in exacting rights, it must reach a level where individuals are deterred
and compelled to think long before embarking on their wrongful conduct or
refraining from an act commanded by the legislator.
The accompanying draft Decree-Law <orig>المرسوم بقانون</orig> has been introduced to amend the Penal Code <orig>قانون الجزاء</orig>,
aiming for the following:
*   First: Addressing the decline in caution and prudence among individuals and the resulting
    injuries and fatalities.
*   Second: Protecting the credit process in the country from debtors who misrepresent the truth of
    their financial position and attempt to portray it as a state of insolvency.
*   First: Manslaughter <orig>القتل الخطأ</orig> and Accidental Injury <orig>الإصابة الخطأ</orig>. It is evident that the crimes of manslaughter and accidental
    injury have not undergone any amendment since the issuance of the Penal Code <orig>قانون الجزاء</orig> in 1960,
    neither in terms of raising the financial values of the fine penalty nor in terms of introducing
    aggravating circumstances for punishment when associated with the material element constituting both crimes.
    This is despite what reality reveals regarding a breach in the aspect of caution
    and prudence among individuals and their lack of deep foresight into the actions they undertake
    and their consequences, especially if it results in multiple fatalities or permanent
    disability. Justice refuses to treat all assumptions equally.
    Therefore, the accompanying draft <orig>المشروع المرافق</orig> deemed it appropriate to raise the maximum limit of the fine penalty
    in Articles (154) and (164), and to add one form of error, which is non-observance
    of laws, in both mentioned articles and Article (44) in its first paragraph,
    to eliminate any dispute raised regarding its omission.
    The draft also added two new articles, (154 bis) and (164 bis),
    which deal with aggravating circumstances for the crimes of manslaughter <orig>القتل الخطأ</orig> and accidental injury <orig>الإصابة الخطأ</orig>.
    These circumstances can be categorized into three sections: the first relates to the gravity of the error,
    the second relates to the gravity of the criminal outcome, and the third relates to the convergence
    of more than one party connected to the gravity of the error or the gravity of the harm, or both,
    as follows:
    Circumstances related to the gravity of the error:
    1 - That the perpetrator consumes an intoxicating, narcotic, psychotropic, or any other substance
    that affects a person's natural faculties, and is under its influence when committing
    the act described as an error. The reason for considering it grave is that intoxication, narcosis, or
    influence on the mind or any other faculties concerned with directing the will, reduces
    awareness and weakens a person's control over their will, thereby diminishing
    the accused's ability to take precautions and care which, if followed, would not have

## Article (284):
Anyone who receives, obtains, possesses, or has transferred to them the debtor's funds, whether by traditional or electronic means, with knowledge of the debt established by an enforceable instrument, with the intent of enabling the debtor to avoid payment, shall be punished with the same penalty specified in the preceding article. This provision does not apply to persons under the guardianship or tutelage of the debtor.
The criminal case shall lapse, regardless of its stage, if the funds are handed over to the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> or the investigative authority <orig>جهة التحقيق</orig> in preparation for the recovery of the debt from the debtor according to the rules of creditor priority.
If the funds are handed over after a final judgment of conviction has been issued, the court that issued the judgment may order the suspension of the execution of the imposed penalty upon the request of the convicted person.
The effect of debt payment, settlement, or pardon stipulated in the preceding article shall apply to anyone who received, obtained, possessed, or had the debtor's funds transferred to them.

## Article (285):
Any debtor who disposes of their assets or rights for less than their market price or value, with a noticeable difference, intending thereby not to fulfill their debts established by an enforceable instrument, shall be punished by imprisonment for a period not exceeding two years and a fine not exceeding three thousand Dinars <orig>دينار</orig>, or by one of these two penalties.
The effect of debt payment, settlement, or pardon stipulated in Article (283) shall apply to the accused in accordance with the provisions of this article.

## Article (286):
The Public Prosecution <orig>النيابة العامة</orig> shall have jurisdiction over the investigation, disposition, and prosecution of the crimes mentioned in this section.

## (Article Four)
Ministers – each within their respective jurisdiction – shall implement this Decree-Law <orig>المرسوم بقانون</orig>, and it shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

</footer># Decree-Law No. 66 of 2025
## Approving Accession to the Agreement Establishing the Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank

*   Having reviewed the Constitution,
*   And Amiri Order <orig>الأمر الأميري</orig> issued on 2 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1445 AH corresponding to 10 May 2024,
*   And Decree No. 84 of 2024 regarding Ministerial Substitutions and Delegations, and its amending decrees,
*   And based on the presentation of the Minister of Foreign Affairs,

## Explanatory Memorandum
### Regarding Decree-Law No. 66 of 2025
### Approving Accession to the Agreement Establishing the Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank

Given the importance of regional cooperation to sustain growth and promote the economic and social development of economies in Asia, and thereby contribute to regional resilience against potential financial crises and other external shocks, the Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank <orig>البنك الآسيوي للاستثمار في البنية التحتية</orig> was established through the aforementioned Agreement.
The Preamble stated that the establishment of the Bank as a multilateral financial institution focused on infrastructure development would help mobilize much-needed additional resources from within and outside Asia and remove financing bottlenecks faced by individual economies in Asia.
Chapter One included the purpose, functions, and membership, where it clarified

his act occurred. The statement means that the text does not apply to those who consume such substances by force or without knowledge, as one of the grounds for exemption from liability stipulated in Article (23) of the Penal Code <orig>قانون الجزاء</orig> would be available to them.
2- An aggravating circumstance exists if the accused refrained from or neglected to assist the victim of the crime in any way at the time of the incident, including requesting assistance for them. This circumstance assumes that the accused was able to prevent the criminal outcome, either by their own means or by seeking assistance from others, but failed to do so, showing disregard for it, leaving them uncaring, or neglecting to take action to help. The aggravation is justified by the fact that the accused added a second error to their initial act, represented by their failure to avert the harmful effects of their wrongful conduct.

### Circumstances Related to the Gravity of the Criminal Outcome:
These include either multiple victims in a crime of involuntary manslaughter or if the accused's act resulted in injury to two or more persons or permanent disability. Although multiple victims in a crime of involuntary manslaughter or accidental injury could lead to multiple crimes committed by the perpetrator, the draft law <orig>المشروع</orig> included the addition of multiple victims as an aggravating circumstance, which in this case prevents the multiplicity of crimes, resulting in a single crime with multiple victims.

### Circumstances Related to the Concurrence of More Than One Aggravating Circumstance:
This also applies if two or more of the circumstances mentioned in Articles (154) bis and (164) bis are present.

### Secondly: Crimes Related to a Debtor's Evasion of Payment
The draft law <orig>المشروع</orig> introduced a new section in Chapter Three (Crimes Against Property) of Book Three (Crimes Against Individuals) of the Penal Code <orig>قانون الجزاء</orig> titled (8) Crimes Related to a Debtor's Evasion of Payment <orig>قرب المدين من الوفاء</orig>, adding four new articles from (283) to (286) concerning a debtor who seeks to weaken their financial standing and present it as insolvent, intending to evade payment of debts established by executive instruments, or to dispose of assets for less than their market value with a significant, unforgivable difference. The draft law also extended criminal protection to the debtor's funds that are transferred or delivered to other parties who are aware of the debt established by the executive instrument and for which enforcement procedures are being taken to collect it, with the intention of enabling the debtor to avoid paying their debts, even if these parties are their spouse, ascendants, or descendants, with the exception of persons under the debtor's guardianship or custodianship, as liability does not extend to them given that the management of their funds is entrusted to the debtor. The draft law stipulated the effect of debt payment on criminal proceedings, settlement procedures, and pardon issued by the creditor. It also assigned to the Public Prosecution <orig>النيابة العامة</orig> the jurisdiction to investigate, dispose of, and prosecute these crimes.
Thus, the draft law came to affirm the protection of individuals' lives and credit operations in the country, and to clearly and unambiguously signal the crimes associated with the accompanying draft law, to deter those who dare to violate its provisions, and to achieve a balance between protecting community interests and guaranteeing individual rights and freedoms.
Finally, it was decided that the provisions of the draft law shall come into effect one month after the date of its publication in the Official Gazette, in accordance with the text of Article (178) of the Constitution <orig>الدستور</orig>.

### Article (2) Objectives

The purpose of this Memorandum is to achieve the following objectives:
- (a) Encourage investment of public and private capital in the region for development purposes, especially
in infrastructure and other regional services.
- (b) Utilize human resources for infrastructure development in the region, including projects and programs
that contribute significantly to economic growth, provide new employment opportunities, and contribute to
the furthest and least fortunate communities.
- (c) Enhance cooperation between the public and private sectors and regional organizations in developing
independent economies, including in infrastructure and other regional services, as well as building private
investment in the region, including investment in infrastructure.
- (d) Access and make maximum use of other information that may be available in those documents.

As used in this Agreement, the term "Financial Resources" includes the following:
(a) Authorized capital in those ordinary and preferred shares and accumulated reserves, except for what is excluded.
(b) Retained earnings that require governmental approvals under Clause (15-1) and which require compliance with the use stipulated in Clause (15).
(c) Retained earnings that do not require governmental approvals and other resources from the balance sheet (5) of this Article or commercial transactions of shares and securities from bonds.
(d) Retained earnings that do not require governmental approvals (11) of the Article.
(e) Financial revenues from special registration from traded papers or from bonds that require compliance with the use stipulated in Clause 15.
(f) Any other funds or revenues that specifically require compliance from the special risk resources referred to in Article (17) of this Agreement.
### Guarantee (f) Use of Resources
Use of disbursement, and bank facilities, which enable the purpose and tasks stipulated respectively in Clauses (1) and (2), and in accordance with sound banking standards.

## Article (22): Shareholders' Council <orig>مجلس المساهمين</orig> and its Formation
1. It consists of two members of the Shareholders' Council <orig>مجلس المساهمين</orig>, who shall appoint a representative and an alternate. They shall be paid an annual remuneration determined by the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>. No amount shall exceed three 10 in the primary activities for clinical services to shareholders.
2. In the event of his secondary education, and the Deputy Chairman of the Council <orig>نائب المجلس</orig>, or the shareholders <orig>المساهمين</orig>, or the Chairman of the Council <orig>رئيس المجلس</orig>, or the Chief Executive Officer <orig>المنفذ الرئيسي</orig> of the company.
3. Shareholders <orig>المساهمون</orig> and owner-shareholders <orig>المساهمين الملاك</orig> are represented, in a significant capacity, not by the sufficient number, but the number of guarantors <orig>الكفلاء</orig> representing the shareholders <orig>المساهمين</orig> in the Shareholders' Council <orig>مجلس المساهمين</orig> may be reached.

## Article (23): Duties and Powers of Shareholders <orig>المساهمين</orig>
1. All powers, leadership of the Shareholders' Council <orig>مجلس المساهمين</orig>.
2. The Shareholders' Council <orig>مجلس المساهمين</orig> shall exercise some, or any of all its powers, and in its form, the following, including:
    (a) Accepting the resignation of a member and appointing a replacement.
    (b) Determining the terms of membership in the Shareholders' Council <orig>مجلس المساهمين</orig>.
    (c) Declaring the eligibility of any of the members.
    (d) Deciding on complaints submitted by any member or conducting an investigation upon resignation by the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>.
    (e) Preparing a draft annual budget <orig>مشروع ميزانية سنوية</orig> and a financial report <orig>تقرير مالي</orig> on its operations, and submitting them to the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> for approval by the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, shareholders <orig>المساهمين</orig> and owners <orig>الملاك</orig>, discussing its proposals, and reviewing Article 25 of this Law.
    (f) Electing the Chairman <orig>الرئيس</orig>, suspending his work, or removing him from office, and reviewing any of his other terms of employment.
    (g) Preparing a genuine justification study <orig>دراسة تبرير حقيقي</orig> for shareholders <orig>المساهمين</orig>, adopting individual conditions, and a statement of profit and loss <orig>بيان الربح والخسارة</orig> for shareholders <orig>المساهمين</orig>.
    (h) Determining total amounts, and allocating profits <orig>الأرباح</orig>, or net profits <orig>الأرباح الصافية</orig> of the company.

- (3) Settlement of other negative aspects not included in the Board of Auditors <orig>مجلس المدققين</orig> under this agreement.

### Article (24): Board of Auditors <orig>مجلس المدققين</orig>: Procedures

1. The Board of Auditors <orig>مجلس المدققين</orig> shall hold its meetings periodically at times deemed necessary by the Board of Auditors <orig>مجلس المدققين</orig>, the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, or the auditor. Its decisions shall be issued by the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> and shall be binding on the Bank <orig>البنك</orig> from the date of their adoption.
2. Auditors' applications for legal registration shall be accepted at a Shareholders' Meeting <orig>مجلس المساهمين</orig>, provided that the number of members does not represent less than 10% of each share group at the meeting.
3. The Board of Auditors <orig>مجلس المدققين</orig> – according to the regulations – is committed to submitting a detailed annual report to the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> to obtain certification from the auditors within six months of holding a meeting, which stipulates the formal obligations deemed necessary by the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>.
4. The Board of Auditors <orig>مجلس المدققين</orig> – by notifying the Bank's <orig>البنك</orig> management – may authorize the submission of official data, and the submission of such lists and reports as may be necessary or appropriate for the purpose of the Bank's <orig>البنك</orig> operations.

### Article (25): Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>: Composition

1. The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall consist of twelve (12) members who may not be members of the Board of Auditors <orig>مجلس المدققين</orig>, and among them:
    (a) (1) The Chairman of the Board of Auditors <orig>رئيس مجلس المدققين</orig> who shall be the other members <orig>الذي يكون الأعضاء الآخرين</orig>.
    (b) (2) The Vice-Chairman of the Auditors <orig>نائب رئيس المدققين</orig> who shall be the non-other members <orig>الذين يكون الأعضاء غير الآخرين</orig>.
2. The members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall be highly competent and qualified in economic and financial affairs, and shall be selected in accordance with the regulations established by the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>. They must be shareholders from the increase of members representing them in each share group.
3. The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> is committed to submitting a detailed annual report to the Shareholders' Council <orig>مجلس المساهمين</orig>, and may increase or decrease a share or track the subscription share date within the limits of applicable regulations as stipulated in Article (20).

## Article (27): Board of Directors and Meetings
1. The Board of Directors shall convene by a decision of its Chairman or his deputy, or upon the request of at least one-third of its members, provided that its meetings are held periodically at least every three months. All members must be notified of the invitation to the meeting at least seven days before its date. Notification of the invitation may be made via email, fax, or any other means determined by the Board.
2. A meeting of the Board of Directors shall not be valid unless attended by the majority of its members. No member may delegate another member to attend the meeting and vote on his behalf.
3. The Board's decisions shall be issued by a majority of the votes of those present. In the event of a tie, the side of the meeting chairman shall prevail. No member may abstain from voting on any decision presented to the Board.
4. The minutes of the Board's meetings shall be recorded in a special register and signed by the meeting chairman and all attending members. The minutes must include the names of the attending members and the decisions taken.

## Article (28): Voting
1. The voting committee for each member shall consist of a project to review votes and procedures. Decisions shall be issued by a majority of votes, and in the event of a tie, the side of the committee chairman shall prevail.
   (a) The voting committee shall consist of three members, selected from among the members of the Board of Directors, and at least one of them must have experience in accounting or law.
   (b) For the validity of the voting committee's decisions, all its members must be present. Its decisions shall be issued by a majority of votes, and in the event of a tie, the side of the committee chairman shall prevail.
   (c) The minutes of the voting committee's meetings must include the names of the attending members and the decisions taken, and shall be signed by the committee chairman and all attending members.
   (d) The decisions of the voting committee must be announced in the Official Gazette, and the announcement must include the names of the attending members and the decisions taken.
2. Voting must take place in the Shareholders' Council, and the results of the voting must be announced in the Official Gazette.

### Article (33): Regarding Communication with the Depository Authority
1. The Bank must provide the Depository Authority with a means of communication to carry out matters related to any issue concerning the licensed manager.
2. The Bank must notify the Depository Authority of any other institution in which the Bank holds a significant stake or where the Bank has deposited retention documents required by the Depository Authority or another party.
3. The Bank must keep decrees at the depository authorities specified by the Board of Directors.

### Article (34): Reports and Information
1. The Bank's primary category of work is the investment category, and the Bank must ensure regular reporting to the Depository Authority of all decisions and procedures under Article (34).
2. The Bank is committed to submitting periodic reports on its operations to the Depository Authority in a manner that facilitates the performance of its function and duties.
3. The Bank must regularly provide the Depository Authority with financial statements and all report information requested by the Depository Authority on a quarterly basis, according to a financial position model and a profit and loss statement that clarifies the Bank's status.
4. The Depository Authority is fully permitted to access information to enhance transparency in its operations, and the Bank facilitates the team reviewing its documents in all its branches and initiatives.

### Article (35): Cooperation with Doctors and International Hospitals
1. The Bank operates in close cooperation with all its doctors, and this forms an essential part of the terms of this service. The Bank must ensure that it has agreements with international hospitals and clinics in the region or in the Bank's operational areas.
2. The Bank must commit to cooperating with international hospitals and clinics in the region or in the Bank's operational areas.

## Article (36) Investments

1.  The revenues mentioned in this Agreement are "revenues" for the partners in fulfilling the obligations due under this Agreement or in connection with this Agreement.
2.  The revenues in this Agreement are a value in connection with this Agreement to the other party.

### Chapter Seven
### Withdrawal and Assignment of Assets

## Article (37) Withdrawal from Membership

1.  Any member may withdraw from the partnership at any time by giving written notice to the principal partner.
2.  Upon the member's withdrawal and the cessation of their validity on the specified withdrawal date, which shall in all cases be no less than six (6) months from the date of receipt of the withdrawal notice, all assets, including the advanced state <orig>الدولة المتقدمة</orig>, must be withdrawn, and the partnership may take necessary measures to cancel their withdrawal and conclude transactions.
3.  The withdrawing member remains responsible for all financial and administrative obligations that they held on the date of their exit as a withdrawing member, and for a period of one week from the date of receipt of the withdrawal notice. The member shall not bear any responsibility for obligations arising from partnership operations concluded after their withdrawal date, as per the withdrawal notice.

## Article (38) Membership Compliance

1.  If any member of the partnership perceives the partnership's performance as a transgression <orig>يرى من الارتكاب أداء الشرك</orig> and causes detriment to claimants, and their damage has been prolonged due to actions of eligibility for superiority <orig>الأهلية للتعالي</orig>, based on the families <orig>الأسر</orig> stipulated in Article (28).
2.  When a member automatically commits unlawful acts, it obliges him, or one or more of his representatives in his capacity and eligibility for superiority <orig>الأهلية للتعالي</orig>, as stipulated in Article (28), to restore the member to good standing.

## Chapter Two

### Article (40): Budget Realization

1.  The Bank must periodically prepare budget analysis reports regarding the costs, receivables, and existing obligations in the departments, as well as regularly disclose the volume of obligations that have not been paid or settled within the timeframe specified by the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> upon the request of the authorities.

### Article (41): Termination of Operations

1.  The Bank may terminate its operations despite the withdrawal of the portfolio, within the limits of its specific eligibility, as stipulated in Article (28).
2.  The Bank must immediately cease its operations upon termination, following correspondence related to the transfer of assets and holdings, and the necessary verification and review for oversight.

### Article (42): Liability of Members and Claims

1.  In the event of the Bank's termination, all members are not liable for obligations beyond their contribution to the Bank's capital. Their liabilities remain limited to their capital contribution, after all outstanding claims have been paid.
2.  All debts owed by the Bank, whether to the Bank or to others, must be paid from the intended dispositions within the Bank or by continuing the sale of the contribution. The Bank may seek assistance within thirty days to withdraw leased properties, and amounts due from administrative staff shall be settled within thirty days from the date of withdrawal of public and real estate properties, which is necessary to ensure adequate distribution of receivables.

2. In all cases, the assets shall be protected from actions taken by any judicial, administrative, legislative, or other authorities, including attachment, confiscation, seizure, freezing, expropriation, or any other form of disposition, or any other measure that would prevent the Basket from performing its functions.
3.  The Basket's properties and assets, as well as its assets or whoever holds title to them, shall enjoy immunity from all forms of seizure, attachment, or confiscation prior to the issuance of a final judgment against the Basket.

### Article (47): Immunity of Assets and Documents

1.  The Basket's properties and funds, whatever their nature and wherever located, shall enjoy absolute immunity from all forms of inspection, confiscation, expropriation, or any other form of seizure or freezing, or any other measure that would prevent the Basket from performing its functions.
2.  The Basket's archives, correspondence, records of all kinds, and documents belonging to it or held by it, shall be inviolable from any interference, inspection, attachment, or confiscation.

### Article (48): Freedom of Assets from Restrictions

The States Parties shall undertake to ensure the freedom of assets from restrictions imposed on them, including restrictions on the transfer of funds or other assets, or on any other form of disposition, or any other measure that would prevent the Basket from performing its functions.

### Article (49): Communications Privilege

Official communications and correspondence made in the context of the Basket's work shall enjoy immunity from any interference, interception, inspection, attachment, or confiscation.

## Article (81): Tax Exemption

1. The Bank, its assets, property, income, operations, and transactions shall remain exempt from all taxes and all customs duties, and shareholders shall also be exempt from any obligations for any taxes or fees.
2. No taxes of any kind shall be levied on any salaries or allowances paid by the Bank to members of the Board of Governors <orig>مجلس المحافظين</orig>, Directors <orig>المديرين</orig> and their deputies, Executive Directors <orig>المديرين التنفيذيين</orig> and their deputies, the President <orig>الرئيس</orig> and Vice-Presidents <orig>نواب الرئيس</orig>, and other officials or employees of the Bank, including experts and consultants performing services for the Bank, except as may be imposed by a Member State <orig>الدولة العضو</orig> with the approval of the shareholders or the Board of Governors <orig>مجلس المحافظين</orig> to levy taxes on its citizens or nationals.
3. No taxes of any kind shall be levied on any obligations or documents issued by the Bank, including any profits or interest thereon, regardless of the entity holding them:
    (a) if such tax would discriminate against these obligations or documents merely because they are issued by the Bank, or
    (b) if the sole legal basis for such tax is the place or currency in which the obligations or documents are issued, or are due or payable, or the location of any office or place of business maintained by the Bank.
4. No taxes of any kind shall be levied on any obligations or documents guaranteed by the Bank, including any profits or interest thereon, regardless of the entity holding them:
    (a) if such tax would discriminate against these obligations or documents merely because they are guaranteed by the Bank.

# Chapter Ten
## Appeals and Grievances Against Decisions
### Article (53) Grievances
1. The employer may, regarding these procedures taken by a decision of the Shareholders' Council <orig>مجلس المساهمين</orig>, submit a grievance against dismissal in any file or against the Director, and subject to the conditions that it may deem appropriate for the document.
2. Notwithstanding the provisions of paragraph (1) of this Article, the person responsible for monitoring certain files is required to respond and approve the work that would facilitate it.
3. The employer may grieve against:
(a) Decisions issued by the Directorate <orig>المديرية</orig> regarding its request in Report No. 4 of Article 17.
(b) Decisions related to obliging the responsible party to submit the documents referred to in paragraph 4 of Article 4.
(c) Decisions issued by the Directorate <orig>المديرية</orig> regarding the request for shareholder registration or the refusal of shareholder registration, which requires the dispute to be brought before the Shareholders' Council <orig>مجلس المساهمين</orig> and no decision is taken thereon within thirty days from the date of submitting the request; or the refusal of shareholder registration related to a liquidation center, following completion within a maximum of three (3) months from the date of the official letter proving the independent registration of shareholders in this letter.

### Article (54) Interpretation
1. Any matter related to the interpretation or application of the provisions of these Regulations that may arise between any member and their associates, or between the Directorate <orig>المديرية</orig> and any member or their associates, or between the Directorate <orig>المديرية</orig> and any member or their associates, or between the Directorate <orig>المديرية</orig>, and unless there is a provision regarding that matter in the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig> of any member, shall be considered regarding that matter.

### Article (55) Arbitration <orig>التحكيم</orig>

If a dispute arises between the Bank or one of its clients, the Bank has the right to request the client, within
thirty days from the date of notification, to agree to refer the dispute to arbitration in accordance with the provisions of
this Article. If the client agrees, a single arbitrator shall be appointed by the parties to the
dispute, or if the parties fail to agree on the appointment of a single arbitrator, the arbitrator shall be appointed by the
President of the Court of First Instance <orig>المحكمة الابتدائية</orig> in any matter agreed upon by both parties.

### Article (56) Choice of Equivalent Consent

The Bank must ensure that the demand from Article 55 does not allow any dispute to be referred
for approval, settlement, or rejection, except after obtaining prior approval from the Shareholders' Management <orig>إدارة المساهمين</orig>.

2.  This Agreement shall be deposited with the Central Bank of Kuwait <orig>البنك المركزي الكويتي</orig> on December 31, 2015.
3.  A copy of this Agreement shall be sent to all concerned parties.

## General Considerations

### Board Members

1.  The maximum number of Board members, in accordance with legal provisions, is nine members.
2.  The number of independent Board members must not be less than one-third of the Board members, and in all cases, their number must not be less than two members.
3.  **Term of Membership in the Board of Directors:**
    a. The term of membership for Board members shall be three years, and they may be reappointed by the General Assembly.
    b. The term of membership for independent (non-executive) and non-independent (non-executive) Board members must be equal.
    c. The term of membership for executive Board members must be equal.
4.  **Ownership Percentage in the Company:**
    a. The ownership percentage held by independent (non-executive) Board members in the company must not exceed 5% of the total issued shares of the company.
    b. The ownership percentage held by non-independent (non-executive) Board members in the company must not exceed 10% of the total issued shares of the company.
    c. The ownership percentage held by executive Board members in the company must not exceed 15% of the total issued shares of the company.
5.  **Voting Percentage:**
    a. The voting percentage held by independent (non-executive) Board members in the company must not exceed 5% of the total issued shares of the company.
    b. The voting percentage held by non-independent (non-executive) Board members in the company must not exceed 10% of the total issued shares of the company.
    c. The voting percentage held by executive Board members in the company must not exceed 15% of the total issued shares of the company.

Commitment under Paragraph 7
Contractors must commit to providing a bank guarantee or a bank bond from one of the local banks covering 10% of the contract value, valid for 115 days from the date of opening the envelopes or 100 days from the date of announcement of the award, whichever is longer.

- For Bidders
  - Bidders must consult the Public Tenders Board <orig>مجلس المناقصات</orig> and follow the necessary procedures to submit their applications within 25 days from the date of announcement of the award.
- Registration of Confidential Documents
  - Confidential documents must be registered at the Registry Office.
- The Guarantee
  - The guarantee must be valid for 115 days from the date of opening the envelopes or 100 days from the date of announcement of the award, whichever is longer.
- The Obligation
  - Contractors must commit to submitting all documents prepared by them in accordance with Article 25 of the Public Tenders Law <orig>قانون المناقصات العامة</orig>, within 25 days from the date of announcement of the award.
- Procedures in Case of Breach
  - In case contractors breach any of the above-mentioned conditions, the Public Tenders Board <orig>مجلس المناقصات العامة</orig> has the right to cancel the award, reject the bid, impose a financial penalty not exceeding 10% of the contract value, or take any other action deemed appropriate by the Board.
- Subsequent Procedures
  - Guarantees submitted by contractors in the initial procedure will not be refunded after the expiry of the specified guarantee period or after the completion of the necessary procedures.
- General Procedures
  - Contractors are not permitted to withdraw their bids after submission except with the approval of the Public Tenders Board <orig>مجلس المناقصات العامة</orig>, and paid fees will not be refunded.

The following provisions all state the same clause: "Contractors are not allowed to assign the contract to any other party except with the approval of the Public Tenders Board."

The purpose of the Bank shall be to: (i) foster sustainable economic development, create wealth and improve infrastructure connectivity in Asia by investing in infrastructure and other productive sectors; and (ii) promote regional cooperation and partnership in addressing development challenges by working in close collaboration with other multilateral and bilateral development institutions.
2. Wherever used in this Agreement, references to "Asia" and "region" shall include the geographical regions and composition classified as Asia and Oceania by the United Nations, except as otherwise decided by the Board of Governors.

### Article 2 Functions
To implement its purpose, the Bank shall have the following functions:
(i) to promote investment in the region of public and private capital for development purposes, in particular for development of infrastructure and other productive sectors;
(ii) to utilize the resources at its disposal for financing such development in the region, including those projects and programs which will contribute most effectively to the harmonious economic growth of the region as a whole and having special regard to the needs of less developed members in the region;
(iii) to encourage private investment in projects, enterprises and activities contributing to economic development in the region, in particular in infrastructure and other productive sectors, and to supplement private investment when private capital is not available on reasonable terms and conditions; and
(iv) to undertake such other activities and provide such other services as may further those functions.

### Article 3 Membership
1. Membership in the Bank shall be open to members of the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development or the Asian Development Bank.
(a) Regional members shall be those members listed in Part A of Schedule A and other members included in the Asia region in accordance with paragraph 2 of Article 1. All other members shall be non-regional members.

2. Members of the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development
or the Asian Development Bank which do not become members in accordance
with Article 58 may be admitted, under such terms and conditions as the Bank
shall determine, to membership in the Bank by a Special Majority vote of the
Board of Governors as provided in Article 28.

3. In the case of an applicant which is not sovereign or not responsible for the
conduct of its international relations, application for membership in the Bank
shall be presented or agreed by the member of the Bank responsible for its
international relations.

## CHAPTER II
## CAPITAL

### Article 4 Authorized Capital

1. The authorized capital stock of the Bank shall be one hundred billion
United States dollars ($100,000,000,000), divided into one million (1,000,000)
shares having a par value of 100,000 dollars ($100,000) each, which shall be
available for subscription only by members in accordance with the provisions of
Article 5.

2. The original authorized capital stock shall be divided into paid-in shares
and callable shares. Shares having an aggregate par value of twenty billion
dollars ($20,000,000,000) shall be paid-in shares, and shares having an aggregate
par value of eighty billion dollars ($80,000,000,000) shall be callable.

3. The authorized capital stock of the Bank may be increased by the Board of
Governors by a Super Majority vote as provided in Article 28, at such time and
under such terms and conditions as it may deem advisable, including the
proportion between paid-in and callable shares.

4. The term "dollar" and the symbol "$" wherever used in this Agreement
shall be understood as being the official currency of payment of the United States
of America.

### Article 5 Subscription of Shares

1. Each member shall subscribe to shares of the capital stock of the Bank.
Each subscription to the original authorized capital stock shall be for paid-in
shares and callable shares in the proportion two (2) to eight (8). The initial
number of shares available to be subscribed by countries which become members
in accordance with Article 58 shall be that set forth in Schedule A.

2. 3. The Board of Governors may, at the request of a member, increase the subscription of such member on such terms and conditions as the Board may determine by a Super Majority vote as provided in Article 28; provided, however, that no such increase in the subscription of any member shall be authorized which would have the effect of reducing the percentage of capital stock held by regional members below seventy-five (75) per cent of the total subscribed capital stock, unless otherwise agreed by the Board of Governors by a Super Majority vote as provided in Article 28.

4. The Board of Governors shall at intervals of not more than five (5) years review the capital stock of the Bank. In case of an increase in the authorized capital stock, each member shall have a reasonable opportunity to subscribe, under such terms and conditions as the Board of Governors shall determine, to a proportion of the increase of stock equivalent to the proportion which its stock theretofore subscribed bears to the total subscribed capital stock immediately prior to such increase. No member shall be obligated to subscribe to any part of an increase of capital stock.

### Article 6 Payment of Subscriptions

1. Payment of the amount initially subscribed by each Signatory to this Agreement which becomes a member in accordance with Article 58 to the paid-in capital stock of the Bank shall be made in five (5) installments, of twenty (20) per cent each of such amount, except as provided in paragraph 5 of this Article. The first installment shall be paid by each member within thirty (30) days after the entry into force of this Agreement, or on or before the date of deposit on its behalf of its instrument of ratification, acceptance or approval in accordance with paragraph 1 of Article 58, whichever is later. The second installment shall become due one (1) year from the entry into force of this Agreement. The remaining three (3) installments shall become due successively one (1) year from the date on which the preceding installment becomes due.

2. Each installment of the payment of initial subscriptions to the original paid-in capital stock shall be paid in dollars or other convertible currency, except as provided in paragraph 5 of this Article. The Bank may at any time convert such payments into dollars. All rights, including voting rights, acquired in respect of paid-in and associated callable shares for which such payments are due but have not been received shall be suspended until full payment is received by the Bank.

## Article 7 Terms of Shares

1. Shares of stock initially subscribed by members shall be issued at par unless the Board of Governors by a Special Majority vote as provided in Article 28 decides in special circumstances to issue them on other terms.
2. Shares of stock shall not be pledged or encumbered in any manner whatsoever, and they shall be transferable only to the Bank.
3. The liability of the members on shares shall be limited to the unpaid portion of their issue price.
4. No member shall be liable, by reason of its membership, for obligations of the Bank.

## Article 8 Ordinary Resources

As used in this Agreement, the term "ordinary resources" of the Bank shall include the following:
(i) authorized capital stock of the Bank, including both paid-in and callable shares, subscribed pursuant to Article 5;
(ii) funds raised by the Bank by virtue of powers conferred by paragraph 1 of Article 16, to which the commitment to calls provided for in paragraph 3 of Article 6 is applicable;

## CHAPTER III
## OPERATIONS OF THE BANK

### Article 9 Use of Resources
The resources and facilities of the Bank shall be used exclusively to implement
the purpose and functions set forth, respectively, in Articles 1 and 2, and in
accordance with sound banking principles.

### Article 10 Ordinary and Special Operations
1. The operations of the Bank shall consist of:
    (i) ordinary operations financed from the ordinary resources of the Bank,
    referred to in Article 8; and
    (ii) special operations financed from the Special Funds resources referred to in
    Article 17.
The two types of operations may separately finance elements of the same project
or program.
2. The ordinary resources and the Special Funds resources of the Bank shall
at all times and in all respects be held, used, committed, invested or otherwise
disposed of entirely separately from each other. The financial statements of the
Bank shall show the ordinary operations and special operations separately.
3. The ordinary resources of the Bank shall, under no circumstances, be
charged with, or used to discharge, losses or liabilities arising out of special
operations or other activities for which Special Funds resources were originally
used or committed.
4. Expenses appertaining directly to ordinary operations shall be charged to
the ordinary resources of the Bank. Expenses appertaining directly to special
operations shall be charged to the Special Funds resources. Any other expenses
shall be charged as the Bank shall determine.

# Article 12 Limitations on Ordinary Operations
1.  The total amount outstanding of loans, equity investments, guarantees and other types of financing provided by the Bank in its ordinary operations under sub-paragraphs 2 (i), (ii), (iii) and (vi) of Article 11 shall not at any time be increased, if by such increase the total amount of its unimpaired subscribed capital, reserves and retained earnings included in its ordinary resources would be exceeded. Notwithstanding the provisions of the preceding sentence, the Board of Governors may, by a Super Majority vote as provided in Article 28, determine at any time that, based on the Bank's financial position and financial standing, the limitation under this paragraph may be increased, up to 250% of the Bank's unimpaired subscribed capital, reserves and retained earnings included in its ordinary resources.
2.  The amount of the Bank's disbursed equity investments shall not at any time exceed an amount corresponding to its total unimpaired paid-in subscribed capital and general reserves.

# Article 13 Operating Principles

The operations of the Bank shall be conducted in accordance with the principles set out below:

1.  The Bank shall be guided by sound banking principles in its operations.
2.  The operations of the Bank shall provide principally for the financing of specific projects or specific investment programs, for equity investment, and for technical assistance in accordance with Article 15.
3.  The Bank shall not finance any undertaking in the territory of a member if that member objects to such financing.
4.  The Bank shall ensure that each of its operations complies with the Bank's operational and financial policies, including without limitation, policies addressing environmental and social impacts.
5.  In considering an application for financing, the Bank shall pay due regard to the ability of the recipient to obtain financing or facilities elsewhere on terms and conditions that the Bank considers reasonable for the recipient, taking into account all pertinent factors.
6.  In providing or guaranteeing financing, the Bank shall pay due regard to the prospects that the recipient and guarantor, if any, will be in a position to meet their obligations under the financing contract.
7.  In providing or guaranteeing financing, the financial terms, such as rate of interest and other charges and the schedule for repayment of principal shall be such as are, in the opinion of the Bank, appropriate for the financing concerned and the risk to the Bank.
8.  The Bank shall place no restriction upon the procurement of goods and services from any country from the proceeds of any financing undertaken in the ordinary or special operations of the Bank.
9.  The Bank shall take the necessary measures to ensure that the proceeds of any financing provided, guaranteed or participated in by the Bank are used only for the purposes for which the financing was granted and with due attention to considerations of economy and efficiency.
10. The Bank shall pay due regard to the desirability of avoiding a disproportionate amount of its resources being used for the benefit of any member.
11. The Bank shall seek to maintain reasonable diversification in its investments in equity capital. In its equity investments, the Bank shall not assume responsibility for managing any entity or enterprise in which it has an investment and shall not seek a controlling interest in the entity or enterprise concerned, except where necessary to safeguard the investment of the Bank.

### Article 15 Technical Assistance

1.  The Bank may provide technical advice and assistance and other similar forms of assistance which serve its purpose and come within its functions.
2.  Where expenditures incurred in furnishing such services are not reimbursable, the Bank shall charge such expenditures to the income of the Bank.

## CHAPTER IV
## FINANCES OF THE BANK

### Article 16 General Powers

In addition to the powers specified elsewhere in this Agreement, the Bank shall have the powers set out below:

1.  The Bank may raise funds, through borrowing or other means, in member countries or elsewhere, in accordance with the relevant legal provisions.
2.  The Bank may buy and sell securities the Bank has issued or guaranteed or in which it has invested.
3.  The Bank may guarantee securities in which it has invested in order to facilitate their sale.

4. The Bank may underwrite, or participate in the underwriting of, securities

5. The Bank may invest or deposit funds not needed in its operations.
6. The Bank shall ensure that every security issued or guaranteed by the Bank
shall bear on its face a conspicuous statement to the effect that it is not an

7. The Bank may establish and administer funds held in trust for other parties,

9. The Bank may exercise such other powers and establish such rules and
regulations as may be necessary or appropriate in furtherance of its purpose and
functions, consistent with the provisions of this Agreement.

### Article 17 Special Funds

1. The Bank may accept Special Funds which are designed to serve the
purpose and come within the functions of the Bank, such Special Funds shall be
resources of the Bank. The full cost of administering any Special Fund shall be
charged to that Special Fund.
2. Special Funds accepted by the Bank may be used on terms and conditions
consistent with the purpose and functions of the Bank and with the agreement
relating to such Funds.
3. The Bank shall adopt such special rules and regulations as may be required
for the establishment, administration and use of each Special Fund. Such rules
and regulations shall be consistent with the provisions of this Agreement, except
for those provisions expressly applicable only to ordinary operations of the Bank.
4. The term "Special Funds resources" shall refer to the resources of any
Special Fund and shall include:
(i) funds accepted by the Bank for inclusion in any Special Fund;
(ii) funds received in respect of loans or guarantees, and the proceeds of any
equity investments, financed from the resources of any Special Fund
which, under the rules and regulations of the Bank governing that Special
Fund, are received by such Special Fund;
(iii) income derived from investment of Special Funds resources; and(iv) any other resources placed at the disposal of any Special Fund.

### Article 18 Allocation and Distribution of Net Income
1. The Board of Governors shall determine at least annually what part of the net income of the Bank shall be allocated, after making provision for reserves, to retained earnings or other purposes and what part, if any, shall be distributed to the members. Any such decision on the allocation of the Bank's net income to other purposes shall be taken by a Super Majority vote as provided in Article 28.
2. The distribution referred to in the preceding paragraph shall be made in proportion to the number of shares held by each member, and payments shall be made in such manner and in such currency as the Board of Governors shall determine.
### Article 19 Currencies
1. Members shall not impose any restrictions on currencies, including the receipt, holding, use or transfer by the Bank or by any recipient from the Bank, for payments in any country.
2. Whenever it shall become necessary under this Agreement to value any currency in terms of another or to determine whether any currency is convertible, such valuation or determination shall be made by the Bank.
### Article 20 Methods of Meeting Liabilities of the Bank
1. In the Bank's ordinary operations, in cases of arrears or default on loans made, participated in, or guaranteed by the Bank, and in cases of losses on equity investment or other types of financing made under sub-paragraph 2 (vi) of Article 11, the Bank shall take such action as it deems appropriate. The Bank shall maintain appropriate provisions against possible losses.
2. Losses arising in the Bank's ordinary operations shall be charged:
    (i) first, to the provisions referred to in paragraph 1 above;
    (ii) second, to net income;
    (iii) third, against reserves and retained earnings;
    (iv) fourth, against unimpaired paid-in capital; and
    (v) last, against an appropriate amount of the uncalled subscribed callable capital which shall be called in accordance with the provisions of paragraph 3 of Article 6.

CHAPTER V
GOVERNANCE

### Article 21 Structure
The Bank shall have a Board of Governors, a Board of Directors, a President, one or more Vice-Presidents, and such other officers and staff as may be considered necessary.

### Article 22 Board of Governors: Composition
1. Each member shall be represented on the Board of Governors and shall appoint one Governor and one Alternate Governor. Each Governor and Alternate Governor shall serve at the pleasure of the appointing member. No Alternate Governor may vote except in the absence of his principal.
2. At each of its annual meetings, the Board shall elect one of the Governors as Chairman who shall hold office until the election of the next Chairman.
3. Governors and Alternate Governors shall serve at such without remuneration from the Bank, but the Bank may pay them reasonable expenses incurred in attending meetings.

### Article 23 Board of Governors: Powers
1. All the powers of the Bank shall be vested in the Board of Governors.
2. The Board of Governors may delegate to the Board of Directors any or all its powers, except the power to:
(i) admit new members and determine the conditions of their admission;
(ii) increase or decrease the authorized capital stock of the Bank;
(iii) suspend a member;
(iv) decide appeals from interpretations or applications of this Agreement given by the Board of Directors;
(v) elect the Directors of the Bank and determine the expenses to be paid for Directors and Alternate Directors and remuneration, if any, pursuant to paragraph 6 of Article 25;
(vi) elect the President, suspend or remove him from office, and determine his remuneration and other conditions of service;
(vii) approve, after reviewing the auditors' report, the general balance sheet and the statement of profit and loss of the Bank;
(viii) determine the reserves and the allocation and distribution of the net profits of the Bank;
(ix) amend this Agreement;(x) decide to terminate the operations of the Bank and to distribute its assets;
and
(xi) exercise such other powers as are expressly assigned to the Board of
Governors in this Agreement.

3. The Board of Governors shall retain full power to exercise authority over
any matter referred to the Board of Directors under paragraph 2 of this Article.

## Article 24 Board of Governors: Procedure

1. The Board of Governors shall hold an annual meeting and such other
meetings as may be provided for by the Board of Directors or called by the
Board of Governors. Meetings of the Board of Governors shall be called by the
Board of Directors whenever requested by five (5) members of the Bank.
2. A majority of the Governors shall constitute a quorum for any meeting of
the Board of Governors, provided such majority represents not less than two-
thirds of the total voting power of the members.
3. The Board of Governors shall by regulation establish procedures whereby
the Board of Directors may obtain a vote of the Governors on a specific question
without a meeting and provide for electronic meetings of the Board of Governors
in special circumstances.
4. The Board of Governors, and the Board of Directors to the extent
authorized, may establish such subsidiary entities, and adopt such rules and
regulations as may be necessary or appropriate to conduct the business of the
Bank.

## Article 25 Board of Directors: Composition

1. The Board of Directors shall be composed of twelve (12) members who
shall not be members of the Board of Governors, and of whom:
(i) nine (9) shall be elected by the Governors representing regional members;
and
(ii) three (3) shall be elected by the Governors representing non-regional
members.
Directors shall be persons of high competence in economic and financial matters
and shall be elected in accordance with Schedule B. Directors shall represent
members whose Governors have elected them as well as members whose
Governors assign their votes to them.
2. The Board of Governors shall, from time to time, review the size and
composition of the Board of Directors, and may increase or decrease the size or
revise the composition as appropriate, by a Super Majority vote as provided in
Article 28.

3. Each Director shall appoint an Alternate Director with full power to act for
him when he is not present. The Board of Governors shall adopt rules enabling
a Director elected by more than a specified number of members to appoint an
additional Alternate Director.

4. Directors and Alternate Directors shall be nationals of member countries.
No two or more Directors may be of the same nationality nor may any two or
more Alternate Directors be of the same nationality. Alternate Directors may
participate in meetings of the Board but may vote only when the Alternate
Director is acting in place of the Director.

5. Directors shall hold office for a term of two (2) years and may be re-
elected.

(a) Directors shall continue in office until their successors shall have
been chosen and assumed office.

(b) If the office of a Director becomes vacant more than one hundred
and eighty (180) days before the end of his term, a successor shall
be chosen in accordance with Schedule B, for the remainder of the
term, by the Governors who elected the former Director. A majority
of the votes cast by such Governors shall be required for such
election. The Governors who elected a Director may similarly
choose a successor if the office of a Director becomes vacant one
hundred and eighty (180) days or less before the end of his term.

(c) While the office of a Director remains vacant, an Alternate Director
of the former Director shall exercise the powers of the latter, except
that of appointing an Alternate Director.

6. Directors and Alternate Directors shall serve without remuneration from
the Bank, unless the Board of Governors shall decide otherwise, but the Bank
may pay them reasonable expenses incurred in attending meetings.

Article 26 Board of Directors: Powers

The Board of Directors shall be responsible for the direction of the general
operations of the Bank and, for this purpose, shall, in addition to the powers
assigned to it expressly by this Agreement, exercise all the powers delegated to it
by the Board of Governors, and in particular:

(i) prepare the work of the Board of Governors;

(ii) establish the policies of the Bank, and, by a majority representing not less
than three-fourths of the total voting power of the members, take decisions
on major operational and financial policies and on delegation of authority
to the President under Bank policies;

(iii) take decisions concerning operations of the Bank under paragraph 2 of
Article 11, and, by a majority representing not less than three-fourths ofthe total voting power of the members, decide on the delegation of such
authority to the President;
(iv) supervise the management and the operation of the Bank on a regular basis,
and establish an oversight mechanism for that purpose, in line with
principles of transparency, openness, independence and accountability;
(v) approve the strategy, annual plan and budget of the Bank;
(vi) appoint such committees as deemed advisable; and
(vii) submit the audited accounts for each financial year for approval of the
Board of Governors.

### Article 27 Board of Directors: Procedure

1.  The Board of Directors shall meet as often as the business of the Bank may
    require, periodically throughout the year. The Board of Directors shall function
    on a non-resident basis except as otherwise decided by the Board of Governors
    by a Super Majority vote as provided in Article 28. Meetings may be called by
    the Chairman or whenever requested by three (3) Directors.
2.  A majority of the Directors shall constitute a quorum for any meeting of
    the Board of Directors, provided such majority represents not less than two-thirds
    of the total voting power of the members.
3.  The Board of Governors shall adopt regulations under which, if there is no
    Director of its nationality, a member may send a representative to attend, without
    right to vote, any meeting of the Board of Directors when a matter particularly
    affecting that member is under consideration.
4.  The Board of Directors shall establish procedures whereby the Board can
    hold an electronic meeting or vote on a matter without holding a meeting.

### Article 28 Voting

1.  The total voting power of each member shall consist of the sum of its basic
    votes, share votes and, in the case of a Founding Member, its Founding Member
    votes.
    (i) The basic votes of each member shall be the number of votes that results
    from the equal distribution among all the members of twelve (12) per cent
    of the aggregate sum of the basic votes, share votes and Founding Member
    votes of all the members.
    (ii) The number of the share votes of each member shall be equal to the number
    of shares of the capital stock of the Bank held by that member.
    (iii) Each Founding Member shall be allocated six hundred (600) Founding
    Member votes.

In the event a member fails to pay any part of the amount due in respect of its obligations in relation to paid-in shares under Article 6, the number of share votes to be exercised by the member shall, as long as such failure continues, be reduced proportionately, by the percentage which the amount due and unpaid represents of the total par value of paid-in shares subscribed to by that member.

2. In voting in the Board of Governors, each Governor shall be entitled to cast the votes of the member he represents.
    (i) Except as otherwise expressly provided in this Agreement, all matters before the Board of Governors shall be decided by a majority of the votes cast.
    (ii) A Super Majority vote of the Board of Governors shall require an affirmative vote of two-thirds of the total number of Governors, representing not less than three-fourths of the total voting power of the members.
    (iii) A Special Majority vote of the Board of Governors shall require an affirmative vote of a majority of the total number of Governors, representing not less than a majority of the total voting power of the members.

3. In voting in the Board of Directors, each Director shall be entitled to cast the number of votes to which the Governors who elected him are entitled and have assigned their votes to him, pursuant to Schedule B, are entitled.
    (i) A Director entitled to cast the votes of more than one member may cast the votes for those members separately.
    (ii) Except as otherwise expressly provided in this Agreement, all matters before the Board of Directors shall be decided by a majority of the votes cast.

Article 29 The President
1. The Board of Governors, through an open, transparent and merit-based process, shall elect a President of the Bank by a Super Majority vote as provided in Article 28. He shall be a national of a regional member country. The President, while holding office, shall not be a Governor or a Director or an Alternate for either.
2. The term of office of the President shall be five (5) years. He may be re-elected once. The President may be suspended or removed from office when the Board of Governors so decides by a Super Majority vote as provided in Article 28.
    (a) If the office of the President for any reason becomes vacant during his term, the Board of Governors shall appoint an Acting Presidentfor a temporary period or elect a new President, in accordance with
paragraph 1 of this Article.

3. The President shall be Chairman of the Board of Directors but shall have
no vote, except a deciding vote in case of an equal division. He may participate
in meetings of the Board of Governors but shall not vote.

4. The President shall be the legal representative of the Bank. He shall be
chief of the staff of the Bank and shall conduct, under the direction of the Board
of Directors, the current business of the Bank.

## **Article 30 Officers and Staff of the Bank**

1. One or more Vice-Presidents shall be appointed by the Board of Directors
on the recommendation of the President, on the basis of an open, transparent and
merit-based process. A Vice-President shall hold office for such term, exercise
such authority and perform such functions in the administration of the Bank, as
may be determined by the Board of Directors. In the absence or incapacity of the
President, a Vice-President shall exercise the authority and perform the functions
of the President.

2. The President shall be responsible for the organization, appointment and
dismissal of the officers and staff in accordance with regulations adopted by the
Board of Directors, with the exception of Vice-Presidents to the extent provided
in paragraph 1 above.

3. In appointing officers and staff and recommending Vice-Presidents, the
President shall, subject to the paramount importance of securing the highest
standards of efficiency and technical competence, pay due regard to the
recruitment of personnel on as wide a regional geographical basis as possible.

## **Article 31 The International Character of the Bank**

1. The Bank shall not accept Special Funds, loans or assistance that may in
any way prejudice, limit, deflect or otherwise alter its purpose or functions.

2. The Bank, its President, officers and staff shall not interfere in the political
affairs of any member, nor shall they be influenced in their decisions by the
political character of the member concerned. Only economic considerations shall
be relevant to their decisions. Such considerations shall be weighed impartially
in order to achieve and carry out the purpose and functions of the Bank.

3. The President, officers and staff of the Bank, in the discharge of their
offices, owe their duty entirely to the Bank and to no other authority. Each
member of the Bank shall respect the international character of this duty and shall
refrain from all attempts to influence any of them in the discharge of their duties.

# CHAPTER VI
## GENERAL PROVISIONS

### Article 32 Offices of the Bank
1. The principal office of the Bank shall be located in Beijing, People's Republic of China.
2. The Bank may establish agencies or offices elsewhere.

### Article 33 Channel of Communication; Depositories
1. Each member shall designate an appropriate official entity with which the Bank may communicate in connection with any matter arising under this Agreement.
2. Each member shall designate its central bank, or such other institution as may be agreed upon with the Bank, as a depository with which the Bank may keep its holdings of currency of that member as well as other assets of the Bank.
3. The Bank may hold its assets with such depositories as the Board of Directors shall determine.

### Article 34 Reports and Information
1. The working language of the Bank shall be English, and the Bank shall rely on the English text of this Agreement for all decisions and for interpretations under Article 54.
2. Members shall furnish the Bank with such information it may reasonably request of them in order to facilitate the performance of its functions.
3. The Bank shall transmit to its members an annual report containing an audited statement of its accounts and shall publish such report. It shall also transmit quarterly to its members a summary statement of its financial position and a profit and loss statement showing the results of its operations.
4. The Bank shall establish a policy on the disclosure of information in order to promote transparency in its operations. The Bank may publish such reports as it deems desirable in the carrying out of its purpose and functions.

### Article 35 Cooperation with Members and International Organizations
1. The Bank shall work in close cooperation with all its members, and in such manner as it may deem appropriate within the terms of this Agreement, with other international financial institutions, and international organizations concerned with the economic development of the region or the Bank's operational areas.
2. The Bank may enter into arrangements with such organizations for purposes consistent with this Agreement, with the approval of the Board of Directors.

### Article 36 References
1. References in this Agreement to Article or Schedule refer to Articles and
Schedules of this Agreement, unless otherwise specified.
2. References in this Agreement to a specific gender shall be equally
applicable to any gender.

## CHAPTER VII
## WITHDRAWAL AND SUSPENSION OF MEMBERS

### Article 37 Withdrawal of Membership
1. Any member may withdraw from the Bank at any time by delivering a
notice in writing to the Bank at its principal office.
2. Withdrawal by a member shall become effective, and its membership shall
cease, on the date specified in its notice but in no event less than six (6) months
after the date that notice has been received by the Bank. However, at any time
before the withdrawal becomes finally effective, the member may notify the Bank
in writing of the cancellation of its notice of intention to withdraw.
3. A withdrawing member shall remain liable for all direct and contingent
obligations to the Bank to which it was subject at the date of delivery of the
withdrawal notice. If the withdrawal becomes finally effective, the member shall
not incur any liability for obligations resulting from operations of the Bank
effected after the date on which the withdrawal notice was received by the Bank.

### Article 38 Suspension of Membership
1. If a member fails to fulfill any of its obligations to the Bank, the Board of
Governors may suspend such member by a Super Majority vote as provided in
Article 28.
2. The member so suspended shall automatically cease to be a member one
(1) year from the date of its suspension, unless the Board of Governors decides
by a Super Majority vote as provided in Article 28 to restore the member to good
standing.
3. While under suspension, a member shall not be entitled to exercise any
rights under this Agreement, except the right of withdrawal, but shall remain
subject to all its obligations.

### Article 39 Settlement of Accounts
1. After the date on which a country ceases to be a member, it shall remain
liable for its direct obligations to the Bank and for its contingent liabilities to the
Bank so long as any part of the loans, guarantees, equity investments or other
forms of financing under paragraph 2 (vi) of Article 11 (hereinafter, other
financing) contracted before it ceased to be a member is outstanding, but it shall
not incur liabilities with respect to loans, guarantees, equity investments or otherfinancing entered into thereafter by the Bank nor share either in the income or the expenses of the Bank.
