*   Proposing policies that enhance the efficiency of supply chains and limit any disruptions that may affect the flow of goods and services.
*   Regularly evaluating the performance of supply chains and monitoring challenges that may hinder the smooth flow of supply.
*   Coordinating with relevant authorities to provide necessary solutions to maintain the continuous flow of goods and services without delay.
*   Submitting recommendations for developing logistical infrastructure and improving storage and distribution mechanisms to support market stability.
*   Monitoring the extent of suppliers' and traders' compliance with regulations governing markets and supply chains, and taking corrective actions when necessary.

### 4. Strategic Stock Monitoring Committee <orig>لجنة متابعة المخزون الاستراتيجي</orig>:
*   The committee monitors the level of strategic stock of essential goods to ensure their sustainable availability and meet consumer needs.
*   It develops plans and procedures to enhance the strategic stock, including determining optimal storage levels for essential goods, and submits its recommendations to the Central Committee <orig>اللجنة المركزية</orig> for approval.
*   It coordinates with relevant authorities to ensure the continuity of food and consumer supplies during crises and emergencies.
*   It monitors changes in demand for essential goods and provides proposals to address any potential shortages in the markets.
*   The committee prepares periodic reports on the status of the strategic stock, in addition to recommendations for maintaining its stability.

### Article (4)
#### Monitoring of Sub-Committees <orig>اللجان الفرعية</orig>
The Central Committee <orig>اللجنة المركزية</orig> is responsible for monitoring the recommendations of the sub-committees <orig>اللجان الفرعية</orig>, and it may add new competencies in line with work requirements and developments. The committee also has the right to establish new committees when needed, after obtaining the Minister's approval, to enhance the efficiency of policy and procedure implementation.

### Article (5)
#### Reports of Sub-Committees <orig>اللجان الفرعية</orig>
Each sub-committee <orig>لجنة فرعية</orig> shall submit periodic reports to the Central Committee <orig>اللجنة المركزية</orig> according to its specified mandate, to present recommendations or decisions for endorsement or review.

### Article (6)
Committee Secretariat

The Minister shall issue a decision to form a team for the secretariat of the Central Committee and its sub-committees, which shall undertake the following tasks:
1. Recording the minutes of meetings held by the Central Committee and its sub-committees.
2. Corresponding with relevant authorities and monitoring the implementation of decisions issued by the Central Committee and its sub-committees.
3. Submitting periodic reports (once every three months) to the Minister, including the most important works and decisions of the Central Committee and its sub-committees.
4. Any other tasks assigned to the team by a decision of the Minister who forms it.

### Article (7)
Grievance Committee

The Minister shall issue a decision to form a grievance committee <orig>لجنة تظلمات</orig> specialized in examining grievances submitted against executive decisions issued by the Central Committee or its sub-committees.

### Article (8)
Financial Remuneration

No financial remuneration shall be allocated to the members of the Central Committee or its sub-committees for their participation in its work.

### Article (9)
Decisions No. (62), (67), (75), (79), (96), and (97) for the year 2020 are hereby repealed, as well as any provisions that contradict this decision.

### Article (10)
This decision shall be implemented from the date of its issuance and shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>. Concerned authorities shall be obligated to implement its provisions, each within its scope of competence.

Minister of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزير التجارة والصناعة</orig>
Khalifa Abdullah Al-Ajeel <orig>خليفه عبد الله العجيل</orig>

<header>
Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig> Issue 1738, Seventy-First Year
266
Sunday, 13 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1446 AH - 11/5/2025 AD
</header>

Decided

# Article One
Conditions for Transfer to Work in Emergency Teams (Shifts):
1. The employee must have spent at least two years in the Commercial Control Department centers as a commercial inspector or assistant inspector.
2. Must have obtained an excellent performance appraisal in the last year of their service.
3. Must not have been subject to any disciplinary action.
4. The number of reports and complaints issued by them must not be less than 100 reports/complaints during the last year of their service.
5. Must pass a one-month refresher course in the field of work of the Commercial Control Department.

# Article Two
Work System for Emergency Teams:
1. Duration of Work: The employee shall work in emergency teams for a period of one year, renewable based on their performance statistics and the report of their assigned emergency chief. Renewal shall be approved by the Undersecretary of the Ministry <orig>وكيل الوزارة</orig> or their authorized representative.
2. Team Formation: Emergency teams in the governorates shall be divided into three shifts (A - B - C), with each shift having a supervisor and each team having a chief.
3. Division of Teams by Governorates:
    *   Emergency team for the governorates of Al-Asimah <orig>العاصمة</orig> and Hawalli <orig>حولي</orig>.
    *   Emergency team for the governorates of Al-Jahra <orig>الجهراء</orig> and Al-Farwaniyah <orig>الفروانية</orig>.
    *   Emergency team for the governorates of Al-Ahmadi <orig>الأحمدي</orig> and Mubarak Al-Kabeer <orig>مبارك الكبير</orig>.
4. Fish Market (Sharq): An emergency team shall be allocated to it with the same formation as stated in item (2).
5. Scope of Work: Each team shall operate within the scope of its assigned governorate, whether in inspection or receiving complaints. The Undersecretary of the Ministry <orig>وكيل الوزارة</orig> or their authorized representative may assign a team or shift specific tasks outside this scope.
6. Administrative Affiliation: Emergency teams shall report to the Undersecretary for the Control and Consumer Protection Sector <orig>وكيل قطاع الرقابة وحماية المستهلك</orig>.
7. Periodic Reports: Each emergency team chief shall submit a report every three months to the Undersecretary for the Control and Consumer Protection Sector <orig>وكيل قطاع الرقابة وحماية المستهلك</orig>, including inspection tours, violation reports, and completed complaints.
8. Rotation: The Undersecretary for the Control and Consumer Protection Sector <orig>وكيل قطاع الرقابة وحماية المستهلك</orig> has the right, in accordance with the interest of work, to conduct rotation among emergency teams (chief, supervisor, employee).

# Article Three
Decision No. 410 of 2019, referred to herein, is hereby repealed, as is any text that contradicts the provisions of this Decision.

# Article Four
Officials – each within their respective jurisdiction – shall implement this Decision, which shall be effective from the date of its issuance and published in the Official Gazette.
Minister of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزير التجارة والصناعة</orig>
Khalifa Abdullah Al-Ajeel <orig>خليفة عبدالله العجيل</orig>

# Ministerial Decision No. (93) of 2025
## Regarding the Regulation of Prices for Medicines and Pharmaceutical Preparations in the State of Kuwait

Minister of Health:
- Having reviewed the provisions of the Decree-Law on the Civil Service System and its amendments,
- And Law No. 28 of 1996 regarding the regulation of the pharmacy profession and the circulation of medicines, and Article No. 13 of the aforementioned Law,
- And Ministerial Decision No. 238 of 1992 regarding the determination of prices for medicines and pharmaceutical preparations in the State of Kuwait,
- And Ministerial Decision No. 232 of 2015 regarding the study and stabilization of foreign currency exchange rates against the Kuwaiti Dinar <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> exchange rate,
- And Ministerial Decision No. 16 of 2021 regarding the adoption of the pricing mechanism for medicines and pharmaceutical preparations,
- And Ministerial Decision No. 58 of 2023 regarding the pricing of medicines, pharmaceutical preparations, and nutritional supplements in the private sector,
- And Ministerial Decision No. 74 of 2023 regarding the determination of prices for medicines and pharmaceutical preparations,
- And Administrative Decision No. 8367 of 2022 regarding the stabilization of foreign currency exchange rates against the Kuwaiti Dinar <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> exchange rate,
- And based on the recommendation of the Medicines Pricing Committee, formed by Ministerial Decision No. 117 of 2018, convened on April 28, 2025,
- And based on the requirements of public interest, and what was presented to us by the Undersecretary <orig>وكيل الوزارة</orig>.
- Has decided –

### Article One
The prices of medicines and pharmaceutical preparations in the attached price list, totaling 69 items, starting with the medicine
5%w/v Dextrose & 0.225%w/v Sodium Chloride IV Injection USP (250ml Bag)
Zarzio 48 MU/0.5ml Solution for Injection or Infusion in Pre-filled Syringe
shall be adopted and added to Ministerial Decision No. 74 of 2023.

### Article Two
This Decision shall be communicated to those concerned for its implementation, and any decision or text conflicting with it shall be revoked. It shall be effective from its date of issuance and published in the Official Gazette.

**Decided the following:**

**Article One:**
The Kuwait International Custody Company <orig>الشركة الكويتية العالمية لأمانة الحفظ</orig> is licensed to engage in the following activities:
1. Custodian.
2. Investment Monitor.

**Article Two:**
The duration of the aforementioned license for the company shall be three years, commencing from the date of issuance of the Authority's license certificate, and after payment of the prescribed fee.
The said company is obligated to pay the prescribed fee upon renewal of the license for any other period in accordance with the provisions of Law No. 7 of 2010 <orig>القانون رقم 7 لسنة 2010</orig>, its executive regulations, their amendments, and the decisions and instructions of the Authority.

**Article Three:**
The Kuwait Clearing Company <orig>الشركة الكويتية للمقاصة</orig> must complete the transfer of all operations related to the custody activity and investment monitoring activity to the Kuwait International Custody Company <orig>الشركة الكويتية العالمية لأمانة الحفظ</orig>, and the resulting procedures, within a maximum period of six months from the date of issuance of this decision.

**Article Four:**
The competent authorities shall implement this decision, each within its jurisdiction, and it shall be effective from its date of issuance and published in the Official Gazette.

# Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig>
## Decision No. (81) of 2025
### Regarding the Renewal of a Collective Investment Scheme License for Baytack Capital Sukuk Fund <orig>صندوق بيتك كابيتال للصكوك</orig>

**Having reviewed:**
- Law No. (7) of 2010 <orig>القانون رقم (7) لسنة 2010</orig> regarding the Establishment of the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> and the Regulation of Securities Activities, its Executive Regulations, and their amendments;
- And the Collective Investment Scheme License Certificate for Baytack Capital Sukuk Fund <orig>صندوق بيتك كابيتال للصكوك</orig> No. (LCIS/2016/0005) issued on 14/06/2022;
- And the request from Baytack Capital Investment Company <orig>شركة بيتك كابيتال للاستثمار</orig> to renew the license for Baytack Capital Sukuk Fund <orig>صندوق بيتك كابيتال للصكوك</orig>;
- And based on Decision No. (04) of 2025 <orig>القرار رقم (04) لسنة 2025</orig> regarding the amendment of final approval authorities for the operational procedures of the Supervision Sector, issued on 12/01/2025.

**Decided the following:**

**Article One:**
Renewal of the collective investment scheme license for Baytack Capital Sukuk Fund <orig>صندوق بيتك كابيتال للصكوك</orig>, for a period of three years, renewable, effective from 13/06/2025.

**Article Two:**
The competent authorities shall implement this decision, each within its jurisdiction, and it shall be effective from its date of issuance and published in the Official Gazette.

Head of Supervision Sector
Ziad Yaqoub Yousef Al-Fulaij <orig>زياد يعقوب يوسف الفليج</orig>
Issued on: May 4, 2025 AD

# Decision No. (83) of 2025
## Regarding
The license application submitted by Al-Dawli Invest Investment Company <orig>شركة الدولي إنفست للاستثمار</orig> to engage in securities activities

Having reviewed:
- Law No. (7) of 2010 regarding the establishment of the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> and the regulation of securities activities, its executive regulations, and their amendments;
- And Decision No. (147) of 2024 regarding the license application submitted by Al-Dawli Invest Investment Company <orig>شركة الدولي إنفست للاستثمار</orig> to engage in securities activities in accordance with Law No. (7) of 2010 regarding the establishment of the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> and the regulation of securities activities and its amendments, issued on 31/10/2024;
- And based on the request of Al-Dawli Invest Investment Company <orig>شركة الدولي إنفست للاستثمار</orig> to renew the preliminary approval issued by the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> for a similar period;
- And based on Decision No. (4) of 2025 regarding the amendment of final approval powers for the work procedures of the Supervision Sector, issued on 12/01/2025.

It was decided as follows:
### Article One
Renewal of the preliminary approval granted to Al-Dawli Invest Investment Company <orig>شركة الدولي إنفست للاستثمار</orig> for licensing the activity of a securities broker not registered on the stock exchange.
This approval is valid for a period of six months, starting from 01/05/2025 and ending on 01/11/2025, for the purpose of fulfilling the criteria specified by the Authority.

### Article Two
The company mentioned in this decision shall be licensed, after completing the requirements referred to in the preliminary approval letter issued by the Authority, for a period of three years renewable from the date of issuance of the Authority's license certificate, and after payment of the prescribed fee.

### Article Three
The competent authorities shall implement this decision, each within its jurisdiction, and it shall be effective from its date of issuance and published in the Official Gazette.

Head of Supervision Sector
Ziad Yaqoub Al-Fulaij <orig>زياد يعقوب الفليج</orig>

# Decision No. (88) of 2025
## Regarding the Collective Investment Scheme License Granted
## to Gulf Capital Investment Company <orig>شركة الخليج كابيتال للاستثمار</orig>
## for the Establishment of Al-Luluah Money Market Fund <orig>صندوق اللؤلؤة للسوق النقدي</orig>
## in US Dollars
## in accordance with Sharia Principles

Having reviewed:
- Law No. (7) of 2010 <orig>القانون رقم (7) لسنة 2010</orig> concerning the Establishment of the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> and the Regulation of Securities Activities, its Executive Regulations, and their amendments;
- The request from Gulf Capital Investment Company <orig>شركة الخليج كابيتال للاستثمار</orig> to establish Al-Luluah Money Market Fund <orig>صندوق اللؤلؤة للسوق النقدي</orig> in US Dollars in accordance with Sharia principles in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>;
- The Articles of Association and Memorandum of Incorporation of Gulf Capital Investment Company <orig>شركة الخليج كابيتال للاستثمار</orig>;
- The Articles of Association, Prospectus, and Service Provider Agreements for Al-Luluah Money Market Fund <orig>صندوق اللؤلؤة للسوق النقدي</orig> in US Dollars in accordance with Sharia principles;
- And based on Decision No. (4) of 2025 <orig>القرار رقم (4) لسنة 2025</orig> regarding the amendment of final approval powers for the operational procedures of the Supervision Sector, issued on 12/01/2025.

It was decided as follows:
### Article One:
Gulf Capital Investment Company <orig>شركة الخليج كابيتال للاستثمار</orig> is granted approval for the establishment of Al-Luluah Money Market Fund <orig>صندوق اللؤلؤة للسوق النقدي</orig> in US Dollars in accordance with Sharia principles. It shall be offered for public subscription with variable capital, ranging between a minimum of USD 7,000,000 (seven million US Dollars only) and a maximum of USD 1,000,000,000 (one billion US Dollars only), with a nominal value of USD 10 (ten US Dollars only) per unit. Unit holders are not permitted to subscribe/participate in the Fund for the first time with less than USD 3,000 (three thousand US Dollars only) and multiples of USD 10 (ten US Dollars only).
### Article Two:
100,000,000 units (one hundred million units only), equivalent to USD 1,000,000,000 (one billion US Dollars only), shall be offered for subscription. The Fund Manager's participation in the Fund's units at establishment must not be less than KWD 100,000 (one hundred thousand Kuwaiti Dinars only) or its equivalent in other currencies as a minimum. The Fund Manager may dispose of or redeem some of the units owned by them if their net value exceeds the minimum limit stipulated in this Article.
The entities receiving subscription applications are:
- Gulf Capital Investment Company <orig>شركة الخليج كابيتال للاستثمار</orig>
- Gulf Bank <orig>بنك الخليج</orig>

### Article Four:
The fund's term is fifteen years, commencing from the date of its registration in the Authority's <orig>الهيئة</orig> funds register. This term is renewable for another similar period upon the request of the fund manager and after obtaining the approval of the Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig> and unit holders who own more than 50% of the fund's issued capital.
### Article Five:
The fund shall be granted a temporary license for a period of three months from the start date of subscription, with the aim of completing the Authority's <orig>الهيئة</orig> requirements and the fund's minimum capital. No activity of the fund may be exercised based on this temporary license.
### Article Six:
The applicant may close the subscription period and suffice with the subscribed capital at any time during the temporary license, provided that the targeted group invited to subscribe is announced or notified at least three working days before the new closing date.
### Article Seven:
In the event that the temporary license period expires without completing the requirements stipulated in Article Five of this resolution, the temporary license shall be revoked, unless the license's validity is extended for another similar period, upon the request of the license applicant and before the expiry of the original temporary license period.
### Article Eight:
The prescribed fees shall be paid within thirty days from the date of issuance of this resolution. In case of failure to pay the fees within the specified period, the resolution shall be considered null and void.
### Article Nine:
The fund shall be licensed for a period of three years from the date of its registration in the Authority's <orig>الهيئة</orig> funds register, after completing the minimum capital.
### Article Ten:
The competent authorities shall implement this resolution, each within its jurisdiction, and it shall be effective from its date of issuance and published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.
Head of Supervision Sector
Ziyad Yaqoub Al-Fulaij <orig>زياد يعقوب الفليج</orig>
Issued on: May 7, 2025 AD

## Resolution No. (89) of 2025
Regarding the refusal to renew the license for securities activities of
Al-Masaleh Al-Istithmariya <orig>المصالح الاستثمارية</orig> Company with the Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig>
**Having reviewed:**
- Law No. (7) of 2010 regarding the establishment of the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> and the regulation of securities activities, its executive regulations, and their amendments;
- And the securities activities license certificate for Al-Masaleh Al-Istithmariya <orig>المصالح الاستثمارية</orig> Company No. (AP/2016/0014) issued on 19/04/2022;
- And the request of Al-Masaleh Al-Istithmariya <orig>المصالح الاستثمارية</orig> Company to renew its securities activities license with the Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig>;
- And based on Resolution No. (4) of 2025 regarding the amendment of final approval powers for the operational procedures of the Supervision Sector, issued on 12/01/2025.
**It has been decided as follows:**
### Article One:
To refuse the renewal of the securities activities license for Al-Masaleh Al-Istithmariya <orig>المصالح الاستثمارية</orig> Company with the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> to practice the activity of investment portfolio manager, as the company does not possess the required capability and efficiency to practice the licensed securities activities.
### Article Two:
The company shall be obligated to hand over clients' funds and assets to them or to those related to their holding, management, or safekeeping, within one year from the date of issuance of this resolution.
### Article Three:
The company shall be obligated to provide the Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig> with a monthly report from the date of issuance of this resolution regarding the termination of the company's operations related to clients' funds and assets, until the completion of the handover process.
### Article Four:
The company shall fulfill all legal obligations stipulated by Law No. (7) of 2010 regarding the establishment of the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> and the regulation of securities activities, its executive regulations, and their amendments, for the period prior to the enforcement of this resolution.
### Article Five:
The competent authorities shall implement this resolution, each within its jurisdiction, and it shall be effective from 18/04/2025 and published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.
Head of Supervision Sector
Ziyad Yaqoub Al-Fulaij <orig>زياد يعقوب الفليج</orig>
Issued on: May 8, 2025 AD

The Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> announces the offering of Practice No. (D.A/M/804) for the maintenance of Microsoft DYNAMICS systems and professional technology services for the websites of entities affiliated with the Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig>. Companies or specialized institutions wishing to participate in this field should apply to obtain the terms and conditions booklet and practice documents during official working hours from (Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> – Bayyan Palace <orig>قصر بيان</orig> – Administrative Building – First Floor – Zone 7 – Tenders and Follow-up Department <orig>إدارة المناقصات والمتابعة</orig>), starting from the date of publication of the announcement in the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>), for a fee of (75/- K.D) only seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> (K-Net payment only) for the non-refundable booklet, effective from Sunday, 11/5/2025, from 8:30 AM until 1:30 PM, taking into account the following:

1.  The deadline for submitting bids is 1:30 PM on Thursday, 22/5/2025, and no bids will be accepted after this time.
2.  Bids shall be submitted in a sealed envelope to the Tenders and Follow-up Department <orig>إدارة المناقصات والمتابعة</orig> – at Bayyan Palace <orig>قصر بيان</orig> – Administrative Building – First Floor – Zone 7.
3.  Submission of an initial security deposit of 2% of the bid value in favor of the Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> in the form of a letter of guarantee or a certified check from one of the Kuwaiti banks, valid throughout the bid validity period of (90) days.
4.  Submission of a valid national labor percentage fulfillment certificate and a valid tax compliance certificate.
5.  A letter of authorization and a copy of the civil ID for the company representative to purchase the practice document.
6.  This practice is indivisible, and alternative offers are not permitted.
7.  The practitioner must submit a letter accompanied by a copy of the registration certificate with the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة وصناعة الكويت</orig>.

The preliminary meeting is scheduled for Monday, 19/5/2025, at 11:00 AM. The bid must remain valid for a period of (90) days from the closing date, with the Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> reserving its right to extend or renew this period for such duration(s) as it deems appropriate to complete the award procedures.

Resolution No. (10) of 2020
Regarding the amendment of some provisions of Resolution No. (1) of 2019
Regarding the regulation of company registration procedures

The Chairman of the Board of Directors of the General Investment Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للاستثمار</orig>,
Having reviewed Law No. (1) of 2010 regarding the General Investment Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للاستثمار</orig>,
And Law No. (1) of 2019 regarding Companies,
And Resolution No. (1) of 2019 regarding the regulation of company registration procedures,
And upon the approval of the Board of Directors of the General Investment Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للاستثمار</orig> at its meeting No. (10) of 2020 dated 15/11/2020,
And as required by the interest of work,
Has resolved:

Article (1)
The text of Article (1) of Resolution No. (1) of 2019, referred to above, shall be replaced with the following text:
Article (1)
The General Investment Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للاستثمار</orig> shall undertake the registration of companies in accordance with the provisions of Law No. (1) of 2019, referred to above, and for that purpose, it shall have all powers stipulated for the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> in this regard.

<table>
| No. | Description                                     |
| :-- | :---------------------------------------------- |
| 1   | Company Registration Application                |
| 2   | Company Memorandum of Association               |
| 3   | Company Articles of Association                 |
| 4   | Capital Deposit Certificate                     |
| 5   | Copy of Civil ID for Founders                   |
| 6   | Copy of Passport for Non-Kuwaiti Founders       |
| 7   | Bank Certificate confirming Capital Deposit     |
| 8   | Any other documents requested by the Authority  |
</table>

Article (2)
The following Article (2) shall be added to Resolution No. (1) of 2019, referred to above, with the following text:
Article (2)
The General Investment Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للاستثمار</orig> shall be committed to registering companies within a period not exceeding (3) working days from the date of completion of all required documents, after payment of the prescribed fees.

Article (3)
All competent authorities, each within its jurisdiction, shall implement this resolution, and it shall be effective from the date of its publication in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

Chairman of the Board of Directors of the General Investment Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للاستثمار</orig>
Sheikh Dr. / Mishaal Jaber Al-Ahmad Al-Sabah <orig>مشعل جابر الأحمد الصباح</orig>

Item 3: Approval was granted to increase the company's authorized, issued, and fully paid-up capital from K.D. 11,624,633.800 (only eleven million six hundred twenty-four thousand six hundred thirty-three Kuwaiti Dinars and 800 fils only) distributed over 116,246,338 shares, with a par value of 100 fils per share, to K.D. 11,973,372.800 (only eleven million nine hundred seventy-three thousand three hundred seventy-two Kuwaiti Dinars and 800 fils only) distributed over 119,733,728 shares, with a par value of 100 fils per share. The increase amounts to K.D. 348,739 (only three hundred forty-eight thousand seven hundred thirty-nine Kuwaiti Dinars only) and represents 3% of the capital. This is achieved by issuing 3,487,390 new shares to be distributed to shareholders registered in the company's records as free bonus shares as of the end of the entitlement day, which is Thursday, 2025/05/22, with the distribution date being Tuesday, 2025/05/27, at a rate of 3% (three shares for every one hundred shares).
The value of this increase will be covered from the retained earnings account, and the Board of Directors is authorized to dispose of any fractional shares arising therefrom as it deems appropriate. The Board of Directors is also authorized to amend the timeline in case the publication procedures are not completed at least eight working days before the entitlement date.

## Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting

The Extraordinary General Assembly of the shareholders of Al-Nafqa Food Group Company <orig>مجموعة النفقة الغذائية</orig> (K.S.C.C. - Closed) held its meeting at 11:00 AM on Thursday, 27/3/2025, in Hawally <orig>حولي</orig> area - Beirut Street - Al-Safat Tower <orig>برج الصفاة</orig> - 9th Floor.
Attended by those owning 20,000,000 shares (twenty million shares), representing 100% of the company's total shares. At the beginning of the meeting, Mr. / Representative of Kuwait Clearing Company <orig>الشركة الكويتية للمقاصة</orig> announced the completion of the legal quorum, and Mr. / Chairman of the Board of Directors <orig>رئيس مجلس الإدارة</orig> opened the meeting, welcoming the attendees. The meeting proceeded to discuss the agenda, and the following was approved:
*   Adding a new object to the company's objects, according to Article (6) of the Articles of Incorporation <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig> and Article (4) of the Company's Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي للشركة</orig>, as follows: -
*   Text before amendment: - The objects for which the company was established are: -
    1.  Management and operation of all food catering <orig>التجهيزات الغذائية</orig> related businesses in restaurants, hospitals, schools, universities, companies, factories, camps, parks, commercial and residential complexes, clubs, institutes, amusement parks, guesthouses, residences, theaters, cinemas, recreational, sports, and tourism projects, and parties, at various grades and levels, including all necessary services, whether directly or indirectly, or on behalf of third parties.
    2.  Manufacturing, importing, selling, packaging, storing, and distributing food, beverages, and other consumer goods in a manner the company deems appropriate, wholesale or retail.
    3.  Purchasing and importing equipment, supplies, and machinery necessary to achieve the company's objectives.
    4.  Representing companies and participating in tenders similar to these objectives.
    5.  Owning movable and immovable properties necessary for its activity within the limits permitted by law.
    6.  Utilizing the company's available financial surpluses by investing them in portfolios managed by specialized companies and entities. The company may directly conduct the aforementioned activities in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> and abroad, either as a principal or an agent. The company may also engage in similar, complementary, necessary, or related activities to its stated objectives.
    7.  Buying and selling shares and bonds solely for the company's benefit.
    8.  Food catering <orig>تجهيزات غذائية</orig>.
*   Text after amendment: The objects for which the company was established are: -
    1.  Buying and selling shares and bonds for the company's account, activity code 649917.
    2.  Retail sale of food products, activity code 472193.
    3.  Food catering <orig>تجهيزات غذائية</orig>, activity code 562100.
    4.  Management of food catering <orig>التجهيزات الغذائية</orig>, activity code 562912.
    5.  Food packaging and wrapping activities, activity code 829205.
    6.  Restaurant, activity code 561010.
    7.  Restaurant management, activity code 562911.
    8.  Snacks, activity code 561034.
    9.  Serving hot and cold ready meals, activity code 561094.
    10. Cafe, activity code 563010.
    11. Manufacturing ready meals and dishes, activity code 107500.
    12. Wholesale of food and beverages, activity code 463000.
    13. Serving healthy meals, activity code 562110.
    14. Serving beverages (coffee shop), activity code 563011.
    15. Cold and hot beverages, activity code 563015.
    16. Ownership of real estate and movables for the company's benefit, activity code 681091.
    17. Refrigerated and frozen goods warehouses (cold storage), activity code 521021.
    18. Cafeteria, activity code 561020.
    19. Fast food restaurants, activity code 561031.
    20. Pizza restaurants, activity code 561032.
    21. Ice cream shops, activity code 563014.
    22. Refreshments, activity code 563020.
    23. Investing financial surpluses in financial portfolios managed by specialized companies and entities, activity code 649918.
    24. Buying and selling land and real estate solely for the company's account, activity code 681011.
In conclusion, Mr. / Chairman of the Board of Directors <orig>رئيس مجلس الإدارة</orig> thanked the attendees, wishing the company continued success.
The meeting concluded at 11:45 AM.

# Automak Automotive Company <orig>شركة أوتوماك للسيارات</orig> (K.S.C.C. - Closed)
## Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting

The Extraordinary General Assembly of the shareholders of Automak Automotive Company <orig>شركة أوتوماك للسيارات</orig> – a Kuwaiti Closed Shareholding Company <orig>شركة مساهمة كويتية مقفلة</orig> – held its meeting at 12:00 PM on Thursday, 01/05/2025, at the company's headquarters.
The meeting was chaired by Mr. Yousef Abdullah Rashid Al-Bahran Al-Roumi <orig>يوسف عبد الله راشد البحران الرومي</orig> – Chairman of the Board of Directors <orig>رئيس مجلس الإدارة</orig>.
Also present at the meeting were:
*   Shareholders (in person and by proxy) holding 181,275,500 shares were present in the meeting room, representing 100% of the company's total capital of 18,127,550 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>ديناراً كويتياً</orig>.
*   Mr. Nasser Saud Al-Manea <orig>ناصر سعود المنيع</orig>, representing Gulf Custody Company <orig>الشركة الخليجية لحفظ الأوراق المالية</orig>, attended via video and audio call (ZOOM).
*   After the conclusion of the company's General Assembly meeting No. 1 for the year 2025, and after the announcement of the availability of the legal quorum for the validity of this Extraordinary General Assembly meeting, the Chairman of the session opened the meeting by welcoming the attendees, then proceeded to present the items on the agenda:
*   Where the amendment of the articles from the Articles of Incorporation <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig> and the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي للشركة</orig> related to the objects for which the company was established was discussed.

# Announcement
Regarding the Issuance of Practice No. (2025/3-2026)
Concerning the Issuance of a Practice for the Maintenance and Development of the Metals Management Portal
The Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> announces the issuance of Practice No. (2025/3-2026) for the benefit of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>, in accordance with the general and special terms and specifications contained in the lists and schedules of the practice documents available at the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> – Procurement and Stores Control <orig>مراقبة المشتريات والمخازن</orig> – Tenders and Contracts Department <orig>قسم المناقصات والعقود</orig> – Ministries Complex <orig>مجمع الوزارات</orig>, Block No. (1), Third Floor, Room No. (1307). A non-refundable fee of (75 K.D.) seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only per copy is required, payable via K-NET <orig>كي نت</orig> during official working hours, starting from noon on Sunday, 11/05/2025. The deadline for submitting bids is 1:00 PM on Monday, 26/05/2025. Bids shall be submitted to the Procurement and Stores Control <orig>مراقبة المشتريات والمخازن</orig>. # Ministry of Defense <orig>وزارة الدفاع</orig>

## Announcement

The Ministry of Defense <orig>وزارة الدفاع</orig> announces Tender No. (1662720) specific to the Ministry of Defense. Tender documents can be obtained from the Military Installations Engineering Department <orig>هندسة المنشآت العسكرية</orig> (Tenders Control – Maidan Hawally <orig>ميدان حولي</orig>).

<table_caption>Ministry of Defense Tender Details</table_caption>
<table>
| Submission | Closing | Price | Preliminary Guarantee |
|:------|:-------|:------|:---|
| 2025-05-11 | 2025-06-24 | 300 K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig> | 6000 K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig> valid for 90 days |
</table>

<table_caption>Ministry of Defense Site Visit and Preliminary Meeting Schedule</table_caption>
<table>
| | Date/Time | Location |
|:---|:-------|:------|
| Site Visit | 9:00 AM on Tuesday, 2025/05/20 | At the headquarters of the Military Installations Engineering Department – Maidan Hawally <orig>ميدان حولي</orig>. |
| Preliminary Meeting | 10:00 AM on Wednesday, 2025/05/21 | At the headquarters of the Military Installations Engineering Department – Maidan Hawally <orig>ميدان حولي</orig>. |
</table>

### Instructions

1- The Ministry of Defense <orig>وزارة الدفاع</orig> must be notified of the names, job titles, and passport copies of candidates attending the site visit seven days prior to the date. No requests submitted via fax will be accepted.
2- The tender purchase receipt must be presented when attending the site visit and preliminary meeting.
3- An authorization letter for purchasing tender documents.
4- A certificate of national labor percentage must be submitted with the bid.
5- The last day to purchase tender documents is Sunday, 2025-06-15, at 1:00 PM.
6- The last day for submitting bids is at 1:00 PM at the Ministry's Mail and Tenders Delivery Center (Al-Dhiyakh <orig>الضياك</orig> No. 1 – P.O. Box No. 1 – Committee for Military Material Purchases and Military Installations Contracts for the Ministry of Defense <orig>لجنة شئون مشتريات المواد العسكرية ومقاولات المنشآت العسكرية لوزارة الدفاع</orig>), next to Gate No. 12, beside the Military Sports Federation.
7- This tender is open to companies specialized in infrastructure development study, design, and supervision works, which meet all conditions stipulated in the tender documents, are registered with the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig>, and submit bids under the two-envelope system.

And the following documents:
- Valid registration receipt with the Ministry of Interior <orig>وزارة الداخلية</orig>. Or
- A registration request for registration with the Ministry and then purchasing tender documents.
Please note that the closing date (bid submission) is Monday, 2025/6/2, from 8:00 AM until 1:00 PM. No bids submitted before or after the mentioned time will be accepted. Bids must be submitted to the Envelope Opening Committee at the Ministry of Interior <orig>وزارة الداخلية</orig> building (Sharq Area <orig>منطقة شرق</orig> – Al-Siddiq School <orig>مدرسة الصديق</orig> – First Floor).

## Announcement

The Ministry of Interior <orig>وزارة الداخلية</orig> announces Tender No. (2025-2024/11) for repair, maintenance, operation, and installation works of materials and equipment at air conditioning (chiller) stations, and related works for various departments within the Ministry, for the General Department of Construction and Maintenance <orig>الإدارة العامة للإنشاءات والصيانة</orig> – Ministry of Interior <orig>وزارة الداخلية</orig>.
Please refer to the General Department of Financial Affairs <orig>الإدارة العامة للشئون المالية</orig> – Tenders Department (Industrial Ardiya <orig>العارضية الصناعية</orig>) to obtain the documents for this tender for a fee of (1,000) K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig> (one thousand Kuwaiti Dinars only) (via K-Net) (non-refundable), and to submit a preliminary guarantee valid for (90) days in the amount of (20,000) K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig> (twenty thousand Kuwaiti Dinars only). Note that the final tender security is (10%) of the total contract value. Applicants must bring a copy of the tender announcement from the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>) or the announcement published on the Ministry of Interior's <orig>وزارة الداخلية</orig> website, along with the following documents:
- Valid registration receipt with the Ministry of Interior <orig>وزارة الداخلية</orig>. Or
- A registration request for registration with the Ministry and then purchasing tender documents.
Please note that the closing date (bid submission) is Monday, 2025/06/16, from 8:00 AM until 1:00 PM. No bids submitted before or after the mentioned time will be accepted. Bids must be submitted to the Envelope Opening Committee at the Ministry of Interior <orig>وزارة الداخلية</orig> building (Sharq Area <orig>منطقة شرق</orig> – Al-Siddiq School <orig>مدرسة الصديق</orig> – First Floor).

# Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig>

## Minutes of the Meeting of the Births and Deaths Committee <orig>لجنة المواليد والوفيات</orig> held on 2025/04/15

After reviewing the requests submitted for amending data in birth and death records, the committee decided to make the amendment listed below in the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>). If the committee does not receive any objection within fifteen days from the date of publication of this announcement, the amendment will be made in the records, and birth or death certificates will be issued accordingly.

## Minutes of the Meeting of the Births and Deaths Committee <orig>لجنة المواليد والوفيات</orig> held on 2025/04/15

The Births and Deaths Committee <orig>لجنة المواليد والوفيات</orig>, stipulated in Article 15 of Law No. 36/1969 and formed by Ministerial Resolution No. 1650/2021, met.
Mr. / Director of the Central Births and Deaths Registry Department <orig>إدارة السجل المركزي للمواليد والوفيات</orig> - Chairman
Dr. / Head of the General Medical Council <orig>المجلس الطبي العام</orig> - Member
Mr. / Head of the Research and Opinion Section <orig>قسم البحوث والرأي</orig> - Member
Mr. / Head of the Registration Section <orig>قسم القيد</orig> - Member
Mr. / Head of the Deaths Section <orig>قسم الوفيات</orig> - Member
Mr. / Legal Researcher <orig>الباحث القانوني</orig> - Member
Mr. / Head of the Records Section <orig>قسم السجلات</orig> - Member
Ms. Shukriya Al-Duraie <orig>شكرية الدريعي</orig> acted as the Committee's Secretary.
The Committee reviewed requests from No. (156) to No. (170) in the attached list, pertaining to amending data in birth and death records for unregistered births and deaths. After reviewing and ensuring the completeness of the documents and records, the Committee decided to announce the amendments and requests in the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>) in two consecutive issues. If, after the legal period (fifteen days) from the date of the last announcement, no objection is submitted, the amendments will be carried out.
<page_end>349</page_end>

- Secondly: Auction Conditions:
- Firstly: The auction shall commence at the basic price specified for the property. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
- Secondly: The bidder whose offer is approved by the judge must deposit, at the time of the sale session, the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees.
- Thirdly: If the bidder whose offer was approved fails to deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the bidding will be reopened at their expense in the same session, based on the price at which the sale was previously awarded.
- Fourthly: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction shall be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by the deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the bidding will be reopened in the same session based on this new price.
- Fifthly: If the initial bidder fails to deposit the full price in the subsequent session, and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the bidding will be immediately reopened at their expense, based on the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session. In this session, no offer not accompanied by a full deposit of its value will be considered. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
- Sixthly: In all cases, the successful bidder shall bear the fees for transfer and registration of ownership, enforcement procedure expenses amounting to 200 K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig>, legal fees, and the cost and expenses of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
- Seventhly: This announcement is published in application of the law, and those directly involved in the sale procedures are responsible for them, without the Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> of the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any responsibility.
- Eighthly: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property in a manner that negates any ignorance of its condition.
- Notice: 1- This sale announcement shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
- 2- The auction award judgment is appealable within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
- 3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the dispossessed owner resides in the property, they shall remain therein as a tenant by operation of law, and the successful bidder shall be obliged to draw up a lease contract in their favor at a fair market rent."

The inspection was conducted as follows:

### Dispute Property
The dispute property is located in Al-Andalus <orig>الأندلس</orig> area, Block 3, Street 6, Plot 152, at the corner of two streets, Street No. 1 and Street No. 3. It is bordered by a neighbor from the southwest and a neighbor from the east (Street No. 3).
The property consists of a basement, ground floor, first floor, second floor, and a roof. The property is clad with Omani stone <orig>الحجر العماني</orig> and has central air conditioning, except for the basement and annexes, and is of old construction.
**Basement Floor**: Open hall + room with bathroom
**Ground Floor**: Consists of a hall, a bathroom, 3 bedrooms served by a bathroom + master bedroom + kitchen + diwaniya <orig>ديوانية</orig> and storage + bathroom
**First Floor**: Hall + 5 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms + kitchen
**Second Floor**: Hall + 4 bedrooms + master bedroom + 2 bathrooms + external kitchen.
Mr. Knowledge Expert / Saad Al-Daihani <orig>سعد الديحاني</orig> took all observations in preparation for valuing the property.

### Second: Auction Terms:
First: The auction shall commence at the base price indicated for the property. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Second: The bidder whose offer is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees at the time of the sale session.
Third: If the bidder whose offer was approved fails to deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the bidding will be reopened at their expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale was previously awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction will be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by the deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the bidding will be reopened in the same session based on this new price.
Fifth: If the first bidder fails to deposit the full price in the subsequent session and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the bidding will be immediately reopened at their expense based on the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session. No offer in this session will be considered unless accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixth: In all cases, the successful bidder shall bear the transfer and registration fees for ownership, enforcement procedure expenses amounting to 200 KWD <orig>د.ك</orig>, legal and expert fees, and advertising and publication costs for the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This announcement is published in accordance with the law, and those directly involved in the sale procedures are responsible for them, without the Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> of the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any responsibility for the property described above.
Eighth: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property with an inspection that negates ignorance.

### Notice:
1- This sale announcement shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The auction award judgment is subject to appeal within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the person whose ownership has been divested is residing in the property, they shall remain in it as a tenant by force of law, and the successful bidder shall be obligated to draw up a lease contract in their favor at a fair market rent <orig>أجرة المثل</orig>."

President of the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig>

It has an entrance from the street side and an entrance from the alleyway side. The property also has an undeveloped plot. There is an entrance to the property on that side and an external door, which appears to be for a diwaniya <orig>ديوانية</orig>. The fourth side of the property is bordered by an adjacent neighbor. The property consists of a ground floor and a first floor. The inspection was carried out as follows:
The committee knocked on the door several times, but no one opened it. Upon asking the agent of the First Appellant about enabling the committee to enter the property, he stated that it was not in the possession of the First Appellant and he could not enable the committee to enter the property, limiting himself to providing guidance about it. Upon asking the knowledge expert <orig>خبير الدراية</orig> at the administration about the possibility of estimating the property's value by inspecting it only from the outside, he stated that he could do so. He also reviewed the previous expert report No. (K 2090/2017/F). The knowledge expert <orig>خبير الدراية</orig> took all observations and reviewed the lawsuit file to submit the report for estimating the value of the aforementioned property.
Description of the Fifth Property:
6- Property Document No. 1997/14238, located in Salwa <orig>سلوى</orig> area - Plot No. 596 - Block No. 10 - Plan M/33808, with an area of 500 m², to be sold by public auction at a base price of KWD 540,000 (Five Hundred and Forty Thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>).
** According to the expert's report
The session began on 11/9/2022. We moved to Salwa <orig>سلوى</orig> area, Block (10), Street (9), Plots (596 and 597), Building No. (35), Document No. (1997/14238), where the properties subject of the lawsuit were stated. This was in the presence and guidance of the agent of the First Appellant, Mr. Abdul Amir Aliwi Shawardi <orig>عبد الأمير عليوي شاوردي</orig>, while the other litigants failed to appear despite being aware of the session's date, and accompanied by the knowledge expert <orig>خبير الدراية</orig>, Mr. Abdul Rahman Al-Habib <orig>عبد الرحمن الحبيب</orig>. The inspection was carried out as follows:
. The property subject of the lawsuit consists of two identical villas. The property area according to the document is 1000 square meters, with 500 square meters for each plot. The property overlooks two streets bearing the numbers (9 and 12), as well as an alleyway. It also has a garden. The exterior cladding of the property is stone, and the air conditioning system is central. The property has one external entrance that extends to a corridor separating the two villas. There are also shaded parking spaces for cars. The property consists of two villas, each villa comprising a basement, a ground floor, a first floor, and a second floor, all of which are identical. Each floor consists of two identical apartments, and each apartment consists of three rooms in addition to a room for domestic workers with a bathroom, a living room, a kitchen, and two bathrooms. Each villa also has an electric elevator in addition to stairs. The building condition of the property is moderate and in good condition, and all apartments are leased.

Property Description: As stated in the Municipality Description Certificate.
Property of Deed No. 2009/3985 located in Al-Sabahiya <orig>الصباحية</orig> area - Plot No. 948 -
Block No. 3 - from Plan No. M/26061, with an area of 375m², to be sold by Public Auction
at a base price of (K.D. 280,000) two hundred and eighty thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>.
** As per the attached expert report.
The property subject of the lawsuit, located in Al-Sabahiya <orig>الصباحية</orig> area, Block (3), Street (11),
Plot (92), House (948). The inspection was carried out as follows:
The property conforms in terms of general and specific specifications to Deed No. T 3985
and has an area of 375 square meters.
The property subject of the lawsuit is a private government residence located on a
single street, with a limestone exterior facade, consisting of a ground floor, first floor, annex, and courtyard
with two entrances from the street.
The ground floor consists of 2 small halls, a bathroom, a kitchen, a storage room, and an annex consisting
of a hall, a kitchen, two bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, and a laundry room, and there is a courtyard.
The first floor consists of a hall, 3 bedrooms, a bathroom, and a laundry room.
The property is in poor condition and requires maintenance.

Secondly: Auction Terms:
Firstly: The auction shall commence at the base price indicated for the property. Participation in the auction requires
payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank
or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Secondly: The bidder whose offer is approved by the judge must deposit, at the time of the sale session,
the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees.
Thirdly: If the bidder whose offer was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price,
otherwise, the bidding will be reopened at their expense in the same session based on the price
at which the sale was previously awarded.
Fourthly: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction will be awarded to them, unless
someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by the deposit of the full auction price.
In this case, the bidding will be reopened in the same session based on this new price.
Fifthly: If the initial bidder fails to deposit the full price in the subsequent session and no one comes forward
to bid with a ten percent increase, the bidding will be immediately reopened at their expense based on the price at which it was
awarded to them in the previous session. In this session, no offer not accompanied by a full deposit of its value will be considered.
The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixthly: The successful bidder shall, in all cases, bear the transfer and registration fees for ownership,
enforcement procedure expenses amounting to K.D. 200 <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>, legal and expert fees,
and advertising and publication costs for the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventhly: This announcement is published in application of the law and at the request of those initiating the sale procedures,
and at their responsibility, without the General Court's <orig>الحكمة الكلية</orig> Registry Department bearing any responsibility.
Eighthly: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property with an inspection that negates ignorance.

Notice:
1- This sale announcement shall be published in the Official Gazette in accordance with Article 266 of the
Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The auction award judgment is appealable within seven days from the date of
its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "
If the person whose ownership has been divested is residing in the property, they shall remain therein as a tenant by force of
law, and the successful bidder shall be obligated to draw up a lease contract in their favor at a fair market rent."

Head of the General Court <orig>الحكمة الكلية</orig>

## Announcement

Practice No. (WA/5-2026/2025)
Supply, installation, inspection, and operation of spare parts for repairing (3) three-phase uninterruptible power supply (UPS) devices and replacing their attached batteries at the Public Prosecutions Complex <orig>مجمع النيابات العامة</orig> building.
The Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig> announces to companies and specialized institutions in this field its need for the supply, installation, inspection, and operation of spare parts for repairing (3) three-phase uninterruptible power supply (UPS) devices and replacing their attached batteries at the Public Prosecutions Complex <orig>مجمع النيابات العامة</orig> building, in accordance with the terms and specifications detailed in the practice documents, which can be obtained from the Tenders Section <orig>قسم العطاءات</orig> – located in the Ministries Complex <orig>مجمع الوزارات</orig> building, Block (14), Third Floor – Financial Affairs Department <orig>إدارة الشئون المالية</orig>, during official working hours starting from Sunday, 11/05/2025, upon payment of a non-refundable subscription fee of (75 K.D.) / seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>ديناراً كويتياً</orig> only. Offers must be submitted to the Tenders Section <orig>قسم العطاءات</orig> at the Ministry, accompanied by an initial security deposit of (2%) of the total value of the offer, provided that this security remains valid throughout the offer's validity period of (90) days. The final deadline for submitting offers is 1:00 PM on Monday, 02/06/2025.
Please note that a preliminary meeting will be held at the Ministry's headquarters in the Financial Affairs Department <orig>إدارة الشئون المالية</orig>, located in the Ministries Complex <orig>مجمع الوزارات</orig>, Third Floor, at 10:00 AM on Monday, 19/05/2025. Whether the practitioner attends this meeting or not, they will be bound by all decisions or recommendations resulting from the meeting, if any.
Director of Financial Affairs Department <orig>مدير إدارة الشئون المالية</orig>

And they requested, being of full legal capacity, the notarization of the following contract:
Company Name: Al-Rawdat Holding Company <orig>شركة الروضات القابضة</orig> (Kuwaiti Closed Shareholding Company)
Address: State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, a Kuwaiti Closed Shareholding Company.
Company Capital: 2,100,000 / Two Million One Hundred Thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only.
** The founders acknowledge their legal capacity to establish a Kuwaiti Holding Shareholding Company (K.C.S.C.) <orig>ش.م.ك. مقفلة</orig> among themselves and their commitment to the rules stipulated for its establishment in accordance with the provisions of Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 1 لسنة 2016</orig>, its amendments, and its executive regulations.
They also acknowledge their commitment to all rules stipulated for the establishment of the company in accordance with the provisions of the following articles:

Article (1)
The preamble is considered an integral part of this contract.

Article (2)
The founders acknowledge that the company was established in accordance with the provisions of Law No. 1 of 2016 <orig>القانون رقم 1 لسنة 2016</orig>, its executive regulations, their amendments, and the provisions of this contract.
The company shall enjoy legal personality from the date of registration, and it may not engage in its activities except from the date of registration and the approval of all regulatory authorities for its engagement in the activity.

Article (3)
The company name is: Al-Rawdat Holding Company <orig>شركة الروضات القابضة</orig> (Kuwaiti Closed Shareholding Company), and its commercial address is the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, a closed shareholding company.

Article (4)
The company's main center is located in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, and its domicile is "in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>". The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> may transfer the main center to any other location within the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, and open branches and agencies for the company inside and outside the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>.
The company's headquarters is considered its legal domicile, which is relied upon for directing correspondence and judicial notices to it and for registering its data in the Commercial Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig>. Any change to this headquarters shall not be recognized until it is registered in the Commercial Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig>.

Article (5)
The duration of this company is unlimited and begins from the date of (registration).

Article (6)
Without prejudice to the provisions of Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 1 لسنة 2016</orig>, its executive regulations, and their amendments, the purposes for which the company was established are to carry out the following:
*   First: Managing subsidiary companies or participating in the management of other companies in which it holds shares and providing them with the necessary support (642010).
*   Second: Investing its funds in trading shares, bonds, and other securities (642020).
*   Third: Owning real estate and movable assets necessary for carrying out its activities within the limits permitted by law (642030).
*   Fourth: Accepting or lending to companies in which it owns shares or stakes, and guaranteeing them to third parties. In this case, the holding company's participation percentage in the capital of the borrowing company must not be less than twenty percent (642040).
*   Fifth: Owning intellectual property rights such as patents, trademarks, industrial designs, franchise rights, and other intangible rights, and exploiting and leasing them to its subsidiary companies or to others, whether inside or outside the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> (642050).
*   Sixth: Owning shares solely for the account of the holding company (642051).
*   Seventh: Business management office for holding activities (642070).
The company may carry out the aforementioned activities in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> and abroad, either directly or by agency. The company may also engage in similar, complementary, necessary, or related activities to its stated purposes.

Article (7)
The company's financial year begins on January 1st and ends on December 31st of each year, with the exception of the company's first financial year, which begins from the date of the company's registration in the Commercial Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig> and ends on December 31st of the following financial year.

Article (8)
The company's authorized capital is set at 2,100,000 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> (Two Million One Hundred Thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>), divided into 21,000,000 shares (Twenty-One Million Shares) with a nominal value of 100 fils (One Hundred Fils), and all shares are cash shares.
The issued capital is 21,000,000 shares (Twenty-One Million Shares) with a nominal value of 100 fils (One Hundred Fils), and the paid-up capital is 525,000 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> (Five Hundred Twenty-Five Thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>). The paid-up capital was paid in cash by the shareholders into the company's bank account with Commercial Bank of Kuwait <orig>البنك التجاري الكويتي</orig> as per a certificate issued by the bank dated 29/04/2025.

Article (9)

### Article (11)
The founders signing this contract undertake to carry out all necessary procedures to complete the establishment of the company, and they are committed to excluding and canceling fictitious and duplicate subscription requests and taking the necessary measures to achieve this. For this purpose, they have authorized Mr. / Hamoud Ahmed Rawdhan Al-Rawdhan <orig>حمود احمد روضان الروضان</orig> to take legal actions, complete the necessary documents, and introduce any amendments that the official authorities deem necessary to be included in the contract or in its attached Articles of Association.
Within three months from the date of completion of the subscription and before the meeting of the Constituent Assembly, the founders must submit to the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> a statement detailing the number of shares subscribed by each founder, their payment of due installments, their names, addresses, the value of the share, and the amount paid thereof.

### Article (12)
The founders of the company shall be jointly and severally liable among themselves for compensating any damage incurred by the company, its shareholders, or third parties due to the invalidity of the company's contract.

### Article (1)
Al-Rawdhan Holding Company <orig>شركة الروضان القابضة</orig>
A Kuwaiti Closed Shareholding Company
Articles of Association
Establishment of the Company
A- Elements of Company Establishment
The company was established in accordance with the provisions of Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 1 لسنة 2016</orig>, its executive regulations, and their amendments. These Articles of Association govern the owners of the closed shares, hereinafter referred to as a Kuwaiti Closed Shareholding Company named: Al-Rawdhan Holding Company <orig>شركة الروضان القابضة</orig>, a Kuwaiti Closed Shareholding Company (K.C.S.C.).

### Article (2)
The company's principal place of business and legal domicile are in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, which is the address considered valid for directing correspondence and judicial notices. Any change to this domicile shall not be recognized unless the change is registered in the Commercial Register.
The Board of Directors may establish branches, agencies, or offices in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> or abroad.

### Article (3)
The duration of this company is unlimited and commences from the date of its publication.

### Article (4)
Without prejudice to the provisions of Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 1 لسنة 2016</orig>, its executive regulations, and their amendments, the purposes for which the company was established are:
First: Managing subsidiary companies or participating in the management of other companies in which it holds shares, and providing them with the necessary support (642010).
Second: Investing its funds in trading shares, bonds, and other securities (642020).
Third: Owning real estate and movable assets necessary for carrying out its activities within the limits permitted by law (642030).
Fourth: Accepting or lending to companies in which it owns shares or stakes, and guaranteeing them to third parties. In this case, the holding company's participation in the capital of the borrowing company must not be less than twenty percent (642040).
Fifth: Owning intellectual property rights such as patents, trademarks, industrial designs, franchise rights, and other intangible rights, and exploiting and leasing them to its subsidiary companies or others, whether within the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> or abroad (642050).
Sixth: Owning shares solely for the account of the holding company (642051).
Seventh: Business management office for holding activities (642070).
The company may carry out these activities in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> and abroad, either directly or through agency. The company may have an interest in or participate in any way with bodies and companies that conduct similar activities or that assist it in achieving its objectives in Kuwait <orig>الكويت</orig> or abroad, and it may establish, participate in, acquire, or affiliate with such bodies or companies.

### Article (5)
(B) Capital and Methods of Increasing It
The authorized and issued capital of the company is set at KWD 21,000,000 (twenty-one million Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>), divided into 2,100,000 shares (two million one hundred thousand shares) with a nominal value of 100 fils (one hundred fils) per share, and all shares are cash shares. The paid-up capital is KWD 5,250,000 (five million two hundred and fifty thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>). The company's issued and paid-up capital consists of cash shares.

### Article (6)
The company's shares are nominal and of equal value, with the value of each share not less than one hundred fils. They may not be issued at a lower value unless approved by the regulatory authorities. (Non-Kuwaitis are not permitted to own them in accordance with the provisions of the law and relevant ministerial decisions).

### Article (7)
The authorized capital may not be increased unless the value of the original shares has been fully paid. The Extraordinary General Assembly may authorize the Board of Directors to determine the date of its implementation, provided that the issued capital has been fully paid. New shares may not be issued for less than their nominal value.

### Article (8)
If the value of the original shares has been fully paid, the authorized capital of the company may be increased by a resolution issued by the Extraordinary General Assembly based on a proposal from the Board of Directors, after obtaining the approval of the regulatory authorities and a report from the auditor in this regard, provided that the resolution for increasing the capital specifies the amount and methods of the increase.

### Article (9)
The company's capital is set at KWD 21,000,000 – two million one hundred thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only.
Share Distribution of the Company:

| 1- Hamoud Ahmed Rawdhan Al-Rawdhan <orig>حمود احمد روضان الروضان</orig> | 21,000 | 210,000 |
| 2- Rajel Hamoud Ahmed Al-Rawdhan <orig>راجل حمود احمد الروضان</orig> | 504,000 | 5,040,000 |
| 3- Noura Hamoud Ahmed Al-Rawdhan <orig>نوره حمود احمد الروضان</orig> | 525,000 | 5,250,000 |
| 4- Ghailaa Hamoud Ahmed Al-Rawdhan <orig>غيلاء حمود احمد الروضان</orig> | 525,000 | 5,250,000 |
| 5- Hind Hamoud Ahmed Al-Rawdhan <orig>هند حمود احمد الروضان</orig> | 525,000 | 5,250,000 |
| Total | 2,100,000 | 21,000,000 |

If it is decided to increase the company's capital, and some shareholders do not exercise their priority right to subscribe to the capital increase shares, the unsubscribed shares shall be allocated to those shareholders of the company who wish to subscribe. If the subscription requests exceed the number of offered shares, they shall be allocated to the subscribers proportionally to their subscribed amounts.
In all cases where the full amount of new shares is not subscribed, the Board of Directors may allocate the unsubscribed shares to new shareholders, and the unsubscribed new shares shall be deemed canceled by operation of law.

### Article (10)
The company may increase its capital through public subscription, as stipulated in Article (160) of Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 1 لسنة 2016</orig>, its amendments, and its executive regulations.
