### Article (11)
The shareholder's right to dispose of their shares is restricted by one or both of the following two restrictions:
1- Requiring a right of priority for the company's shareholders to purchase shares that their owner wishes to sell.
2- Requiring the Board of Directors' approval of the share purchaser.
Dispositions referred to in Article (172) of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig> are exempted from these two restrictions.
(This provision does not apply to companies listed on the stock exchange).

### Article (12)
Before disposing of their shares, the shareholder must notify the company of the terms of sale. The disposition of shares shall not be effective until ten days have elapsed from the date of notification without any of the shareholders submitting a request to purchase the shares. If a shareholder submits a request to purchase the shares, this must be done at the price stated in the terms of sale.

### Article (13)
Without prejudice to the provisions regarding the company's purchase of its own shares, if the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> rejects the purchaser, it must purchase the shares on behalf of the company within ten days from the date the Board <orig>المجلس</orig> is notified of the approval request. In this case, the purchase shall be made at the price at which the shareholder agreed to sell their shares.

### Article (14)
**Subscription**
The founders <orig>المؤسسون</orig> who signed the Articles of Association <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig> subscribed to the full issued and paid-up capital of the company, consisting of 21,000,000 shares (twenty-one million shares), distributed among them, each according to their subscription ratio in the Articles of Association <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig>. An amount of 525,000 K.D. (five hundred and twenty-five thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>) of the nominal value of the shares they subscribed to has been paid into the company's bank account at Commercial Bank of Kuwait <orig>البنك التجاري الكويتي</orig>, as per the attached bank certificate dated 2025/04/29.
The remaining part of the share value shall be paid within a maximum period of five years from the date of the company's registration in the Commercial Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig>, and on the dates specified by the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>. If a shareholder delays in paying the installment due on the shares on time, the company must, after fifteen days from the date of warning them, offer their shares for sale to the other shareholders. The company shall recover from the sale price of the shares, with priority over all creditors of the shareholders, the value of the unpaid installments, interest, and any expenses incurred by the company. The remainder shall be returned to the shareholder. If the sale price of the shares is insufficient, the company shall claim the remaining amount from the shareholder's private assets.

### Article (15)
Share ownership inevitably entails the shareholder's acceptance of the Articles of Association <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig>, the provisions of the company's Articles of Incorporation <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig>, and the resolutions of its General Assembly <orig>جمعيتها العامة</orig>.

### Article (16)
Each share grants its owner the right to an equal, non-discriminatory share in the ownership of the company's assets and in the distributed profits.

### Article (17)
The company shall maintain a special register with a clearing agency <orig>وكالة مقاصة</orig>, in which the names of shareholders, their nationalities, domiciles, the number and type of shares owned by each, and the value paid for each share shall be recorded. Any changes to the registered data shall be noted in the shareholders' register in accordance with the information received by the company or the clearing agency <orig>وكالة مقاصة</orig>. Any interested party may request the company or the clearing agency <orig>وكالة مقاصة</orig> to provide them with data from this register.

### Article (18)
**Founding Assembly**
Within three months of the completion of the subscription and before the meeting of the Founding Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig>, the founders <orig>المؤسسون</orig> must submit to the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> a statement detailing the number of shares they subscribed to, the payment of due installments by subscribers, the names of the subscribers, the number of shares each subscribed to, the value of the share, and the amount paid thereof.

### Article (19)
The founders <orig>المؤسسون</orig> must call for the Founding Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> to convene within three months from the date of completion of the subscription. If this period elapses without the Assembly <orig>الجمعية</orig> being held, the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> shall, within fifteen days from the expiry of the said period, call for the Founding Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> to convene.

### Article (20)
The invitation to attend the meeting of the Founding Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig>, including the agenda, time, and place of the meeting, shall be sent by one of the following methods:
1. Registered letters sent to all subscribers at least two weeks before the scheduled date of the meeting.
2. Advertisement, which must be published twice, with the second advertisement published at least seven days after the date of the first advertisement and at least seven days before the meeting.
3. Hand delivery of the invitation to shareholders or their legal representatives at least one day before the meeting, with an endorsement on a copy of the invitation confirming receipt.
4. Any other modern means of communication specified in the Executive Regulations <orig>اللائحة التنفيذية</orig> of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig>.
The Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> must be notified in writing of the agenda, date, and place of the meeting at least seven days before its convening, for its representative to attend.
The meeting of the Founding Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> shall be chaired by the person elected by the Assembly <orig>الجمعية</orig> for this purpose.

### Article (21)
The meeting of the Founding Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> shall not be valid unless attended by shareholders with voting rights representing more than half of the subscribed shares. If this quorum is not met, the Assembly <orig>الجمعية</orig> must be called for a second meeting with the same agenda within a period of no less than seven days and no more than thirty days from the date of the first meeting. The second meeting shall be valid regardless of the number of attendees.
A new invitation for the second meeting may not be sent if its date was specified in the invitation to the first meeting. Resolutions shall be issued by an absolute majority of the shares present at the meeting. The meeting may be held using modern communication means for shareholders, their proxies, representatives of relevant regulatory bodies, the company's auditors, and anyone whose attendance is required.
This shall be in accordance with the rules and procedures specified in the Executive Regulations <orig>اللائحة التنفيذية</orig>.

### Article (22)
The founders <orig>المؤسسون</orig> shall submit to the Founding Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> a report containing comprehensive information on all incorporation operations and the amounts spent, along with supporting documents. This report shall be placed in a location specified by the founders <orig>المؤسسون</orig> for subscribers to review, at least seven days before the Assembly <orig>الجمعية</orig> meeting, and this shall be indicated in the invitation to subscribers to attend the meeting.

### Article (23)
The Founding Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> shall be competent to address the following matters:
1. Approving the company's incorporation procedures after verifying their validity and conformity with the provisions of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig> and the company's Articles of Association <orig>عقد الشركة</orig>.
2. Approving the valuation of in-kind contributions, if any, as stipulated in Article (11) of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig>.
3. Electing the members of the first Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>.
4. Appointing the auditor and determining their fees.
5. Declaring the final incorporation of the company.
A copy of the minutes of the Founding Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> meeting, including the resolutions adopted, shall be sent to the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>. The first Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> must publish the company's Articles of Association <orig>عقد الشركة</orig> and register it in the Commercial Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig> within thirty days from the date of the final declaration of the company's incorporation.

### Article (24)
**Shareholders' Rights and Obligations**
A member of the company shall, in particular, enjoy the following rights:
1. Receiving profits and obtaining bonus shares decided for distribution.
2. Participating in the company's management through membership in the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> and attending general assemblies <orig>الجمعيات العامة</orig> and participating in their deliberations, in accordance with the provisions of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig> and these Articles of Association <orig>النظام</orig>. Any agreement to the contrary shall be null and void.
3. Obtaining, at least seven days before the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> meeting, the company's financial statements for the expired accounting period, the Board of Directors' <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> report, and the auditor's report.
4. Disposing of his owned shares and priority in subscribing to new shares.
5. Obtaining a share of the company's assets upon liquidation after settling its debts.

### Article (25)
A member of the company shall, in particular, be obligated to the following:
1. Paying the installments due on his shares upon their due dates and compensating for delay in payment.
2. Paying the expenses incurred by the company to collect unpaid installments of his share value, and the company may execute on the shares to satisfy its rights.
3. Implementing the resolutions issued by the company's General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>.
4. Refraining from any act that harms the financial or moral interests of the company and being obligated to compensate for damages arising from violating this.

### Article (26)
The General Assembly of Shareholders <orig>الجمعية العامة للمساهمين</orig> may not do the following:
1. Increasing the shareholder's financial burdens or increasing the nominal value of the share.
2. Decreasing the percentage of net profits to be distributed to shareholders as specified in the company's Articles of Association <orig>عقد الشركة</orig>.
3. Imposing new conditions, other than those mentioned in the Memorandum of Association <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig> or these Articles of Association <orig>النظام</orig>, related to the shareholder's right to attend and vote in General Assemblies <orig>الجمعيات العامة</orig>.
These provisions may be deviated from with the written consent of all shareholders or by a unanimous vote in which all shareholders participate, and by completing the necessary procedures to amend the company's Articles of Association <orig>عقد الشركة</orig>.

### Article (27)
**A - Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>**
The company shall be managed by a Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> consisting of 3 members (three members), and the term of membership shall be three years, renewable.
If it is not possible to elect a new Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> for the company within the specified period, the existing Board shall continue to manage the company's affairs until the reasons cease and a new Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> is elected.

### Article (28)
Shareholders shall elect the members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> by secret ballot, and it may be stipulated in the company's Articles of Association <orig>عقد الشركة</orig> that no more than half of the first Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> members shall be elected from among the company's founders.

### Article (29)
The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall elect by secret ballot a Chairman of the Board <orig>رئيساً للمجلس</orig> and a Vice-Chairman <orig>نائباً للرئيس</orig>. The Chairman of the Board of Directors <orig>رئيس مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall represent the company in its relations with third parties and before the judiciary, in addition to other powers specified in the Articles of Association <orig>العقد</orig>. His signature shall be considered as the signature of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> in the company's relations with third parties. He shall implement the Board's resolutions and adhere to its recommendations. The Vice-Chairman <orig>نائب الرئيس</orig> shall act in place of the Chairman <orig>الرئيس</orig> in his absence or if he is prevented from exercising his powers.

### Article (30)
The company may have a Chief Executive Officer <orig>رئيساً تنفيذياً</orig> appointed by the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> from among its members or from others, who shall be entrusted with the management of the company. The Board shall define his powers and authorities in signing on behalf of the company.

### Article (31)
The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> may distribute work among its members according to the nature of the company's business. The Board may also delegate one of its members, a committee of its members, or a third party to perform one or more specific tasks, supervise an aspect of the company's activity, or exercise some of the powers or competencies entrusted to the Board.

### Article (32)
Any shareholder, whether a natural or legal person, may appoint a representative to the company's Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> in proportion to the shares he owns in it. The number of Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> members selected in this manner shall be deducted from the total number of elected Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> members. Shareholders who have representatives on the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> may not participate with other shareholders in electing the remaining Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> members, except to the extent exceeding the proportion used in appointing their representatives to the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>. A group of shareholders may form an alliance among themselves to appoint one or more representatives for them on the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> in proportion to their combined ownership.
These representatives shall have the same rights and duties as elected members.
The shareholder shall be responsible for the actions of his representatives towards the company, its creditors, and its shareholders.

### Article (33)
A meeting of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall not be valid unless attended by half of the members, provided that the number of attendees is not less than three. Board members may use modern communication methods. Resolutions may be passed by circulation with the approval of all Board members.
The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> must meet at least six times during the year, and a greater number of meetings may be agreed upon.

### Article (34)
Minutes of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> meetings shall be recorded and signed by the attending members and the Board Secretary <orig>أمين سر المجلس</orig>. Any member who did not approve a resolution taken by the Board may record his objection in the meeting minutes.

### Article (35)
If a Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> member's position becomes vacant, he shall be succeeded by the shareholder who received the highest number of votes among those who did not win Board membership. If that person is prevented, he shall be succeeded by the next in line. The new member shall only complete the term of his predecessor.
However, if the vacant positions reach one-quarter of the original positions, the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> must call the General Assembly of Shareholders <orig>الجمعية العامة للمساهمين</orig> for a meeting within two months from the date the last position became vacant, and it shall elect those who will fill the vacant positions.

### Article (36)
The following conditions must be met by anyone nominated for membership in the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>:
1. Must have legal capacity to act.
2. Must not have been previously convicted of a felony with a custodial sentence, or a crime of bankruptcy due to negligence or fraud, or a crime against honor or trust, or a custodial sentence for violating the provisions of this law, unless his reputation has been restored.
3. Must personally own, or the person he represents must own, a number of the company's shares.
4. If a member of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> loses any of the aforementioned conditions, his membership shall cease.

### Article (37)
Membership in the company's Board of Directors <orig>مجلس إدارة الشركة</orig> shall not be included within the maximum number of memberships referred to in Article 234 of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig>.
A person may be the chairman of the board of directors of more than one closed joint-stock company.

### Article (38)
The Chairman or a member of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, even if representing a natural or legal person, may not,

A member of the Board of Directors may dispose of their shares in the company during their membership on the Board, without prejudice to the restrictions stipulated in the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig>, the company's articles of association, or these regulations.

**Article (39)**
Members of the Board of Directors may not disclose to shareholders, outside of General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> meetings, or to third parties, any company secrets they have become aware of due to their management of the company. Otherwise, they shall be subject to dismissal and held liable for compensating damages resulting from the violation.

**Article (40)**
The Chairman of the Board of Directors <orig>رئيس مجلس الإدارة</orig> or any member of the Board may not combine membership in the board of directors of two competing companies, or participate in any work that would compete with the company, or trade for their own account or for the account of others in any branch of activity practiced by the company. Otherwise, the company shall have the right to demand compensation from them or to consider the operations they conducted for their own account as if they were conducted for the company's account, unless this is done with the approval of the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig>.

**Article (41)**
The total remuneration of the Chairman and members of the Board of Directors <orig>أعضاء مجلس الإدارة</orig> may not exceed ten percent of the net profit after deducting depreciation and reserves and distributing a profit of not less than 5% of the capital to shareholders (a higher percentage may be agreed upon). An annual remuneration not exceeding six thousand dinars <orig>دينار</orig> may be distributed to the Chairman of the Board of Directors and to each member of this Board from the date of the company's establishment until the achievement of profits that allow for the distribution of remuneration in accordance with the preceding paragraph. The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> is obligated to submit an annual report to be presented to the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> for approval, provided that it accurately includes a detailed statement of the amounts, benefits, and advantages received by the Board of Directors, regardless of their nature or designation.

**Article (42)**
No representative on the Board of Directors, nor the Chairman, nor any member of the Board of Directors, nor any member of the executive management, nor their spouses, nor their second-degree relatives, may have a direct or indirect interest in contracts and dispositions concluded with or on behalf of the company, unless authorized by the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig>.

**Article (43)**
The company may not lend to any of its Board members, the Chief Executive Officer <orig>الرئيس التنفيذي</orig>, their spouses, or their relatives up to the second degree, or their affiliated companies, unless there is authorization from the company's Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig>. Any action taken in violation thereof shall not be enforceable against the company, without prejudice to the rights of good-faith third parties.

**Article (44)**
The Chairman of the Board of Directors <orig>رئيس مجلس الإدارة</orig> and its members are responsible towards the company, shareholders, and third parties for all acts of fraud, abuse of authority, any violation of the law or the company's articles of association, and for errors in management. The General Assembly's <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> discharge of their liability for their management shall not prevent the filing of a liability lawsuit against them, particularly regarding matters related to a special benefit for them, their spouses, or their first-degree relatives, or a conflict existing between them and the company.

**Article (45)**
The liability stipulated in the preceding article shall be personal, attaching to a specific member, or joint among all members of the Board of Directors <orig>أعضاء مجلس الإدارة</orig>. In the latter case, all members shall be jointly and severally liable to pay compensation, unless a group of them objected to the decision that incurred the liability and recorded their objection in the minutes.

**Article (46)**
The company may file a liability lawsuit against the members of the Board of Directors <orig>أعضاء مجلس الإدارة</orig> due to errors that cause damage to the company. If the company is in liquidation, the liquidator <orig>المصفى</orig> shall undertake to file the lawsuit.

**Article (47)**
Any shareholder <orig>مساهم</orig> may individually file a liability lawsuit on behalf of the company if the company fails to do so. In this case, the company must be joined as a party for compensation to be awarded to it, if applicable. A shareholder may also file their personal lawsuit for compensation if the error has caused them damage. Any agreement to the contrary shall be null and void.

**B – General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>**

**Article (48)**
The Ordinary Annual General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية السنوية</orig> shall convene upon an invitation from the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> within three months following the end of the fiscal year, at the time and place designated by the Board of Directors. The Board may invite the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> to a meeting whenever necessary. The Board of Directors must issue an invitation for the General Assembly to meet upon a reasoned request from a number of shareholders owning ten percent of the company's capital, or upon the request of the auditor <orig>مراقب الحسابات</orig>, within twenty-one days from the date of the request. The agenda shall be prepared by the inviting party. The provisions related to the founding assembly stipulated in Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 1 لسنة 2016</orig> and its executive regulations and amendments shall apply to the procedures for inviting the General Assembly and the quorum for attendance and voting.

**Article (49)**
Every shareholder <orig>مساهم</orig>, regardless of the number of their shares, has the right to attend the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>, and shall have a number of votes equal to the number of votes allocated to that class of shares. A shareholder may not vote for themselves or for those they represent on matters related to their personal interest, or a conflict existing between them and the company. Any condition or decision that violates this shall be null and void. A shareholder may delegate another person to attend on their behalf. The Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig> shall issue the rules regulating the disclosures required in special proxies for those representing shareholders at the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العمومية</orig>. Anyone claiming a right over shares that contradicts what is recorded in the company's shareholder register may apply to the judge of urgent matters <orig>قاضي الأمور الوقتية</orig> to obtain an order on petition to deprive the disputed shares of voting for a period specified by the judge or until the dispute is settled by the competent court, in accordance with the procedures stipulated in the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law <orig>قانون المرافعات المدنية والتجارية</orig>.

**Article (50)**
Voting for candidates for Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> membership shall be subject to the cumulative voting system <orig>نظام التصويت التراكمي</orig>, which grants each shareholder voting power equal to the number of shares they own, allowing them to cast all their votes for one candidate or distribute them among the candidates they choose, without repeating these votes.

**Article (51)**
The General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> meeting shall be chaired by the Chairman of the Board of Directors <orig>رئيس مجلس الإدارة</orig>, or their deputy, or a person delegated by the Board of Directors for that purpose, or a person elected by the General Assembly from among the shareholders or others.

**Article (52)**
Subject to the provisions of the law, the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> shall, in its annual meeting, be competent to take decisions on matters falling within its jurisdiction, and in particular the following:
1.  The Board of Directors' <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> report on the company's activity and financial position for the ended fiscal year.
2.  The auditor's <orig>مراقب الحسابات</orig> report on the company's financial statements.
3.  A report on any violations observed by regulatory authorities <orig>الجهات الرقابية</orig> and for which penalties were imposed on the company.
4.  The company's financial statements.
5.  The Board of Directors' <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> proposals regarding profit distribution.
6.  Discharge of the liability of the Board of Directors <orig>أعضاء مجلس الإدارة</orig> members.

7. Electing or dismissing members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, and determining their remuneration.
8. Appointing the company's auditor, determining their fees, or authorizing the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> to do so.
9. Reporting on transactions that have occurred or will occur with related parties, where related parties are defined according to International Accounting Standards.

### Article (53)
By a resolution issued by the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> of the company, the chairman or one or more members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> may be dismissed, or the company's Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> may be dissolved and a new board elected, based on a proposal submitted by a number of shareholders owning no less than one-quarter of the company's issued capital.
Upon the issuance of a resolution to dissolve the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> and the election of a new board at the same meeting, the Assembly may decide either that the existing board continues to manage the company's affairs until the new board is elected, or to appoint a temporary management committee whose primary task is to call the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> to elect the new board, within one month of its appointment.

### Article (54)
The Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> may not discuss matters not included in the agenda, unless they are urgent matters that arose after the agenda was prepared or became apparent during the meeting, or if requested by a supervisory authority <orig>الجهات الرقابية</orig>, the auditor, or a number of shareholders owning five percent of the company's capital. If, during the discussion, the information related to some of the presented matters is found to be insufficient, the meeting must be postponed for a period not exceeding ten working days if requested by a number of shareholders owning one-quarter of the issued capital shares. The postponed meeting shall be convened without the need for new invitation procedures.

### Article (55)
The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> must implement the resolutions of the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>, unless those resolutions violate the law, the articles of incorporation, or these bylaws.
The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> must present the violating resolutions to the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> in a meeting called to discuss the aspects of the violation.

### Article (56)
The provisions related to the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> shall apply to the Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig>, taking into account the provisions stipulated in the following articles:

### Article (57)
The Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> shall convene upon an invitation from the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, or upon a reasoned request from shareholders owning five percent of the company's issued capital, or from the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>. The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> must invite the Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> to a meeting within thirty days from the date of submitting the request.
If the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> fails to invite the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> within the period stipulated in the preceding paragraph, the Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig> shall issue the invitation for the Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> within fifteen days from the expiry date mentioned in the preceding paragraph.

### Article (58)
The meeting of the Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> shall not be valid unless attended by shareholders owning three-quarters of the company's issued capital. If this quorum is not met, an invitation shall be extended for a second meeting, which shall be valid if attended by those representing more than half of the issued capital. Resolutions shall be issued by a majority exceeding half of the total shares of the company's issued capital.

### Article (59)
Subject to other competencies stipulated by law, the Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> shall be competent in the following matters:
1. Amending the company's articles of association.
2. Selling the entire project for which the company was established, or disposing of it in any other way.
3. Dissolving, merging, transforming, or splitting the company.
4. Increasing or decreasing the company's capital.

### Article (60)
Any resolution issued by the Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> shall not be effective until the publication procedures are completed.
The approval of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> must be obtained if the resolution relates to the company's name, objectives, or capital.

### Article (61)
Any shareholder may file a lawsuit for the nullification of any resolution issued by the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> or the Ordinary or Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية أو غير العادية</orig> that violates the law, the company's articles of incorporation, or these bylaws, or that is intended to harm the company's interests, and may claim compensation when necessary.
Furthermore, resolutions of the Ordinary and Extraordinary General Assemblies <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية وغير العادية</orig> that prejudice the rights of the minority may be challenged. The challenge shall be made by a number of the company's shareholders owning fifteen percent of the issued capital, provided they were not among those who approved those resolutions.

### Article (62)
Company Accounts
The company's financial year begins on January 1st and ends on December 31st of each year, with the exception of the company's first financial year, which begins from the date of the company's registration in the Commercial Register <orig>السجل</orig> and ends on December 31st of the following financial year.

### Article (63)
Annually, by a resolution issued by the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> based on a proposal from the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, a percentage of no less than ten percent of the net profits shall be deducted to form a statutory reserve <orig>احتياطي إجباري</orig> for the company.
The Assembly may cease this deduction if the statutory reserve <orig>الاحتياطي الإجباري</orig> exceeds half of the company's issued capital.
The statutory reserve <orig>الاحتياطي الإجباري</orig> may only be used to cover company losses or to ensure the distribution of profits to shareholders at a rate not exceeding five percent of the paid-up capital in years when the company's profits do not allow for the distribution of this percentage, due to the absence of an optional reserve <orig>احتياطي اختياري</orig> that permits the distribution of this percentage of profits. What was deducted from the statutory reserve <orig>الاحتياطي الإجباري</orig> must be returned to it when the profits of subsequent years allow, unless this reserve exceeds half of the issued capital.
Additionally, one percent (1%) shall be deducted and allocated to the account of the Kuwait Foundation for the Advancement of Sciences <orig>مؤسسة الكويت للتقدم العلمي</orig> from the company's net profit.

### Article (64)
Annually, a percentage shall be deducted from the gross profits, determined by the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> after consulting the auditor, for the depreciation of the company's assets or to compensate for their decrease in value. These funds shall be used to purchase necessary materials, machinery, and facilities or to repair them, and these funds may not be distributed to shareholders.

### Article (65)
The Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> must decide to deduct a percentage of the profits to meet the company's obligations under labor and social insurance laws. A special fund may be established to assist the company's workers and employees.

### Article (66)
Annually, by a resolution issued by the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> based on a proposal from the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, a percentage not exceeding ten percent of the net profits may be deducted to form an optional reserve <orig>احتياطي اختياري</orig> allocated for purposes determined by the Assembly.

### Article (67)
The Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig>, based on a proposal from the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, may distribute profits to shareholders at the end of the financial year. For this distribution to be valid, it must be from actual profits, in accordance with recognized accounting principles, and this distribution must not affect the company's paid-up capital or guarantee a financial period.

# Ministry of Social Affairs <orig>وزارة الشؤون الاجتماعية</orig>
## Announcement
Announces the opening of nominations for honoring pioneering projects in social work fields, which are scheduled to be honored at the Eleventh Meeting of the Committee of Their Excellencies Ministers of Social Affairs / Social Development, hosted by the State of Kuwait during 2025.
Types of projects are as follows:
- A pioneering project in social work implemented by civil society organizations and institutions (voluntary sector).
- A pioneering project in social work implemented by commercial sector institutions (private sector).
Criteria and conditions for nominating the aforementioned projects:
1. The institution nominated for honoring must be from civil society and private sector institutions contributing to community work, social responsibility, and development efforts.
2. The institution must have provided significant services to the community in the social development field.
3. The institution must have presented or developed an existing project in its fields of work.
4. The contributions and services provided must be voluntary contributions, or within the scope of social responsibility, or aimed at developing aspects of the national economy.
Project areas eligible for nomination:
1. Innovative ideas for pioneering development projects in the field of development.
2. Development projects in the field of social care homes and social rehabilitation centers.
3. Development projects concerned with childhood and its services.
4. Projects that support social partnership and civil society institutions.
5. Projects that defend the rights of marginalized or vulnerable social groups and work to empower them.
6. Charitable projects in community development.
It is stipulated that the projects referred to in this announcement, whose works are to be honored, must be (clear - media-highlightable - non-profit), as only two institutions from the State of Kuwait will be honored, one for each of the sectors (civil/voluntary - private).
Nomination forms must be filled out and sent to the Department of Foreign Relations at the Ministry of Social Affairs <orig>وزارة الشؤون الاجتماعية</orig>. The deadline for receiving nomination forms is the end of May 2025, and they can be sent via email according to the conditions outlined in the regulatory framework.

| 11/5/2025 | 22/5/2025 | 75 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> | (K.D. 1,500) only one thousand five hundred Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only, or in the form of a certified check or a letter of guarantee valid for (90) days in favor of the Public Authority for Sport <orig>الهيئة العامة للرياضة</orig> from the closing date |
</table>

A preliminary meeting for bidders has been scheduled at the Authority's headquarters (Fifth Floor) at 11:30 AM on Wednesday, 14/5/2025.
Bids must be submitted from 9:00 AM until 2:00 PM on the closing date. Bids must be delivered in sealed envelopes with red wax and placed in the box designated for practices at the Authority's headquarters (Ground Floor). No bids received after the specified closing time for the practice will be accepted.
*   Bidders must adhere to the instructions regarding bid submission (CD) on the website of the Public Authority for Sport <orig>الهيئة العامة للرياضة</orig> (Pas.gov.kw/tenders).
*   Companies / bidders wishing to submit inquiries or clarifications must do so at the time and place specified above in the preliminary meeting schedule (inquiry session). No inquiries will be considered after the deadline.
*   All documents must be submitted on a (CD) and a non-reproducible hard copy, except for the bid form and preliminary insurance, which must be submitted as a hard copy.
*   Bids shall be valid for (90) ninety days from the date of bid opening. Any bid not accompanied by the original or a copy of the receipt for purchasing the practice documents, the preliminary guarantee, and the national labor support certificate issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> for the year 2025 will be excluded.
*   The bidder must attach a valid 'To Whom It May Concern' certificate issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> stating that there is no suspension on the bidder's file regarding government contracts registered with the Authority or any of the mentioned violations.
*   And according to Article (10) of Law No. 8 of 2010 regarding work in the private sector, and noting that any bid that does not include this certificate will be excluded.
*   The bidder must attach a valid 'To Whom It May Concern' certificate issued by the Ministry of Electricity, Water and Renewable Energy <orig>وزارة الكهرباء والماء والطاقة المتجددة</orig> stating clearance from consumption debts.
The practice is open to all companies and establishments specialized in the required works and registered with the Public Authority for Sport <orig>الهيئة العامة للرياضة</orig> and the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig> for the year 2025, for a fee of (K.D. 75) seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only, payable via K-Net (non-refundable except in cases stipulated by Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> circulars), accompanied by the following: –
1- A copy of the practice announcement in the Official Gazette.
2- A copy of the company's registration with the Authority for the year 2025.
3- A written letter of authorized delegation with the Authority, accompanied by (a copy of the Civil ID – a copy of the signature authorization).
*   Owners of small and medium-sized enterprises <orig>المشروعات الصغيرة والمتوسطة</orig> are exempted from the fees prescribed for purchasing practice documents, in accordance with the text of Article (39) of Law No. 74/2019 regarding amendments to Public Tenders Law No. 49/2016.
*   Owners of small and medium-sized enterprises <orig>المشروعات الصغيرة والمتوسطة</orig> wishing to apply for the practice must attach a valid certificate issued by the National Fund for the Care and Development of Small and Medium Enterprises <orig>الصندوق الوطني لرعاية وتنمية المشروعات الصغيرة والمتوسطة</orig> confirming their accreditation as a small or medium enterprise.
In accordance with the text of Article (48) of Public Tenders Law No. 49/2016, which states: "Bid envelopes shall be opened at the time and place specified in the practice documents in a public session in the presence of bidders or their representatives."
*   This announcement serves as an invitation for interested bidders to attend, as companies wishing to attend the bid opening session have the right to coordinate with the competent committee before the day the session is held.
Note: The Authority may cancel the practice without stating reasons and without any objection from the bidders.
*   For more information, please visit the website of the Public Authority for Sport <orig>الهيئة العامة للرياضة</orig> (Pas.gov.kw).

<footer>
Deputy Director General for Finance and Cost Management Sector

Announcement
The Public Authority for Sport <orig>الهيئة العامة للرياضة</orig> announces the issuance of Public Practice No. PAS / 2025/2026 for the maintenance and development of the Authority's website, its associated systems, and mobile application, in sealed envelopes according to the terms and specifications contained in the practice documents, which can be obtained from the Services and Supplies Department – Tenders Section.
</footer>

by public auction at the headquarters of the Bait Al-Mal <orig>بيت المال</orig> Control Department, affiliated with the Administration, located in Al-Sulaibiya <orig>الصليبية</orig> on the Sixth Ring Road.
Those wishing to purchase should attend the auction site on the specified date, taking into account the following sales conditions:
1. The Auction Sales Committee <orig>لجنة البيع بالمزاد</orig> may sell the goods in one lot or several lots, depending on the sales circumstances.
2. The successful bidder shall bear a brokerage commission of 2% of the sale price.
3. The successful bidder must pay the value of the goods only via K-Net, according to the assessment of the Auction Sales Committee <orig>لجنة البيع بالمزاد</orig>.
4. The successful bidder must remove the goods from the Bait Al-Mal <orig>بيت المال</orig> Control Department headquarters urgently and within 5 (five) to 7 (seven) days after the auction is awarded. Otherwise, any goods will be seized and sold in the next auction if the successful bidder fails to remove them within the specified period.
5. If the goods are not sold for any reason in the auction, the committee has the right to offer them for sale in the subsequent auction.
6. The Administration has the right to stop, postpone, or reschedule the sale if a suitable price is not obtained or for any reasons it deems contrary to its interests.
7. The Auction Sales Committee <orig>لجنة البيع بالمزاد</orig> may cancel or postpone the auction for any reason it deems appropriate.
8. Since the goods will be sold as is, bidders must inspect them to ascertain their condition, quality, and type at the aforementioned address during the auction sale.
9. In the event that the successful bidder refrains from paying the sale price or part thereof, the General Administration of Customs <orig>الإدارة العامة للجمارك</orig> has the right to resell the goods at their expense. If the price does not reach the amount at which the auction was first awarded, the bidder shall be obliged to pay the difference. In this case, the Administration has the right to bar them from participating in any future auctions.
10. The Administration is not responsible for any action or use of the goods that violates applicable laws and legislations.
11. This sale is conducted in accordance with the provisions of Law No. 10 of 2003 regarding the Unified Customs System <orig>النظام الموحد للجمارك</orig> and its regulating decisions.
12. All bidders must adhere to health and preventive requirements.

# General Presidency of the National Guard <orig>الرئاسة العامة للحرس الوطني</orig>
Announcement
The General Presidency of the National Guard <orig>الرئاسة العامة للحرس الوطني</orig> announces the offering of Qualification No. (2-2026/2025) for local training centers to hold conferences and training programs outside the State of Kuwait, in accordance with the conditions stated in the qualification documents.
Therefore, training centers wishing to participate in this qualification must register on the official website of the General Presidency of the National Guard <orig>الرئاسة العامة للحرس الوطني</orig> (www.kng.gov.kw) to purchase the qualification documents for a non-refundable fee of (75/-) K.D. (seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars) only. Payment is to be made through the National Guard's website using the (K-NET) service.
The preliminary meeting will be held on Tuesday, 2025/5/20, at (10:00) AM at the General Presidency of the National Guard <orig>الرئاسة العامة للحرس الوطني</orig> building - Digital - Faisal Al-Jareed <orig>فيصل الجريد</orig> Building. Participating training centers must also print the minutes of the preliminary meeting from the General Presidency of the National Guard's <orig>الرئاسة العامة للحرس الوطني</orig> website (www.kng.gov.kw), approve it, and attach it with the bid documents.
Please note that the deadline for submitting bids is at 1:00 PM on Tuesday, 2025/6/17.

Fax: (24999858), extension (66769), Phone: (66270006).

### Required Documents

1.  A letter of authorization to purchase the booklet of general and special conditions for this practice for the person present to purchase it, along with a copy of their civil ID, approved by the authorized signatory of the company, and providing us with a letter of approval of the signatory's signature for the company, approved by the Central Tenders Committee <orig>لجنة المناقصات المركزية</orig>.

# Kuwait Institute for Scientific Research <orig>معهد الكويت للأبحاث العلمية</orig>
Announcement

The Kuwait Institute for Scientific Research <orig>معهد الكويت للأبحاث العلمية</orig> announces its procurement plan for the fiscal year (2025-2026) for tenders, practices, and contracts that will be issued in accordance with Article No. (33) and Article No. (88) of Law No. 49 of 2016 concerning Public Tenders <orig>القانون رقم 49 لسنة 2016 بشأن المناقصات العامة</orig>, and Article (148) of Circular No. (5) of 2020 concerning the Public Entities Procurement System <orig>تعميم رقم (5) لسنة 2020 بشأن نظام الشراء للجهات العامة</orig>.
The Kuwait Institute for Scientific Research <orig>معهد الكويت للأبحاث العلمية</orig> is pleased to announce its plan for contracts for supply, contracting, services, maintenance, and consultations whose estimated value exceeds (5,000 K.D.) for the fiscal year 2025/2026, in accordance with the attached tables for tenders, practices, and contracts that will be issued in accordance with Article No. (88) of Law No. 49 of 2016 concerning Public Tenders <orig>القانون رقم 49 لسنة 2016 بشأن المناقصات العامة</orig>, as amended by Law No. 74 of 2019 <orig>القانون رقم 74 لسنة 2019</orig> and its Executive Regulations issued by Decree No. 30 of 2017 <orig>المرسوم رقم 30 لسنة 2017</orig>, and Article (148) of Circular No. (5) of 2020 concerning the Public Entities Procurement System <orig>تعميم رقم (5) لسنة 2020 بشأن نظام الشراء للجهات العامة</orig>.
